Jose began working 10 years ago because he felt he needed to learn this trade.  He had initiative to start his own business after several years, once he saw that the business was profitable because he caught the eye of his buyers.  He provides good results, and manages well.

He began buying his own tools and now has a small shoe workshop with 12 employees.  He specializes in men’s shoes because there are few shops that make them.  He sells his products in Managua, Matagua, and to two buyers in Masaya who travel to Honduras to sell the shoes that he makes.  His are quality products and he has maintained his customers’ loyalty.  He buys his raw materials in shoe shop supply stores in his area.

He needs this loan to be able to buy leather because demand is increasing and this loan will be very helpful.  He believes that this loan will help him increase his income and satisfy his customers and keep their loyalty.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: G.s El Pantanal #3 Group

texts.es:
Doña Cristina  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  sus  3 hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una chiclera a la cual se dedica desde hace más de 9 años.
Doña Cristina  el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de  dulces, confites, chicles, bombones,  refrescos etc. Con el crédito  espera que sus ventas aumenten gracias a que contara con más capital fresco y tener así mas mercadería que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan.
Doña Cristina  así mismo espera que mejore un poco su situación económica y la de su familia y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como una  glorieta más grande y   reconocida de la zona.
Doña Cristina al igual que sus compañeras de grupo  espera seguir  trabajando con Prisma y tener salud para  poder  apoyar a  sus hijos a que se conviertan en personas de bien  para la sociedad.
Doña María de los Ángeles su negocio es la  chiclera y venta de dulces  desde hace 7 años 
Doña Mritza   su negocio es la venta  de comida  desde hace 10 años.
Doña Emerita su negocio es  una glorieta  desde hace más de 5 años.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Abril  del 2013
texts.en:
Cristina is a very enterprising person and lives with her three children in the community of Choluteca in southern Honduras.  She has been selling chewing gum for over nine years.  She needs a loan to buy sweets, sugar-coated snacks, chewing gum, bonbons, soft drinks, etc.  With the loan, and by purchasing more merchandise to offer her customers, she hopes to increase her sales.

Cristina hopes to improve her and her family's economic situation through this investment.  In a few years she hopes to have her business situated on the largest city square and be well-known in the area.

Just like the other members in the group, Cristina hopes to stay healthy and continue working through Prisma to support her children so they can become good citizens.

María de los Ángeles sells sweets and chewing gum and has been in business for seven years.
Mritza has been in the food business for ten years.
Emerita has been in the garden business for five years.


Choluteca, Honduras - April, 2013.

loans.use: To buy sweets, sugar-coated snacks, chewing gum, bonbons, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Alicia María

texts.es:
Alicia, se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer emprendedora y guerrera, le ha tocado sacar a sus dos hijos adelante debido a que su cónyuge nunca respondió. Motivo que la impulsó a crear su propio negocio. 
Desde joven aprendió el oficio de la confección, por lo cual se dedica a la elaboración de ropa interior y exterior, actividad que alterna con la venta de productos por catálogo. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de tela, hilos, accesorios y productos de belleza. 
Espera que con dicha inversión pueda garantizarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alicia is known as an enterprising, hard-working woman who has had to raise her two children alone because her husband never took responsibility.  That is what motivated her to set up her own business.

When she was young she learned how to sew, so she now makes clothing, both outerwear and underwear.  She also sells catalogue products.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, accessories and beauty products through catalogue.  She hopes this investment will guarantee a quality education for her children as well as improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, accessories and beauty products.

loans.name: Amanda De Jesús

texts.es:
Amanda a sus 60 años de edad, es una mujer entusiasta y con muchas ganas de buscar un mejor futuro para sus tres hijos y nietos. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la venta de calzado en el centro de la ciudad, en una pequeña chaza que logró construir con dedicación y años de trabajo.
Su familia es su principal motivación. Labora diariamente de ocho de la mañana a siete de la noche.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de incrementar las ventas para el día de madres. Espera que la calidad de vida de su hogar mejore y poder brindarles a sus nietos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Amanda, 60, is a very enthusiastic woman who is determined to seek a better future for her three children and grandchildren.  For over 20 years she has been selling shoes in the city center out of a small stall that she was able to build with much dedication and hard work.

Her family is her main motivation and she works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products so she can increase sales for Mother's Day.  She hopes the quality of life in her household will improve so she can give her grandchildren a good education.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Ángel de 60 años de edad, es una campesina, radicada desde hace más de 20 años en el municipio de Caucasia, Antioquia. Se dedica a la cría y engorde pollos como actividad comercial. Desde hace unos meses decidió vender en su casa refrescos y mecatos para complementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su negocio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de un mayor número de pollos, concentrado y surtido para sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ángel, 60, is a farmer who has lived for over 20 years in the municipality of Caucasia, Antioquía.  She raises and sell chickens for a living.  Several months ago she decided also to sell soft drinks and pastries for extra income to improve her lifestyle.

Her greatest goal is to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy more chickens and animal feed, as well as other goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy chickens, animal feed and other goods.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora de 62 años de edad, asegura que una de sus mayores pasiones es bordar, por lo cual se dedicó a la elaboración de acolchados desde su juventud, actividad que sigue realizando y le ha suministrado los recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Gracias a su experiencia y la calidad de sus productos, hoy goza de buena clientela y de reconocimientos por su labor. 
En la actualidad el nivel de pedidos es alto, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de telas e insumos con el fin de cumplir con los pedidos solicitados.
Espera que con dicha inversión, pueda expandir su negocio y ofrecerles a las madres cabeza de familia un empleo digno.
texts.en:
Dora, 62, says that one of her greatest passions is embroidery, so she has been making quilts ever since she was young.  This business has allowed her to earn an income to support her family.  Thanks to her experience and the quality of her products, she now has a good customer base and is known for her work.

Since the volume of orders she has now is high, she is requesting a loan to buy fabric and supplies so she can fill all the orders.

She hopes to expand her business through this investment and would like to offer decent jobs to women who are heads of household.

loans.use: To buy fabric and supplies (thread, needles).

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара – лидер группы «Ийгилик -3», ей 25 лет, воспитывает 2 детей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Динара занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав с суммы (KGS) 15,000 сом в 2003 году. Благодаря упорному труду,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2,0 га земли с посевом зерновых культур. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка бычков на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, и в будущем купить еще 2 га земли для посева.
texts.en:
Dinara is the leader of the group "Iigilik - 3". She is 25 years old and raises two children. As the main source of income for her family, Dinara works in animal husbandry and crop farming. She began her business with 15,000 som in 2003 and thanks to persistent work she now has 2 hectares of land planted with crops. 

With the goal of future business development, Dinara turned to the micro-finance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for an 85,000 som loan, with which she plans to purchase steer to feed and resell. Dinara intends to invest the extra income in future development of her business. Eventually she would like to purchase two more hectares for planting.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Atyrbubu

texts.ru: Атырбубу  – участник группы «Ийгилик -3», ей 55 лет, мать 3 детей. Атырбубу работает библиотекарем и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. В целях развития своего бизнеса, Атырбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка минеральных удобрений и ГСМ.  Доходы от кредита  Атырбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, и мечтает построить новый дом со всеми удобствами.
texts.en:
Atyrbubu is a member of the group "Iigili -3". She is 55 years old and the mother of three children. She is a librarian, but also works in animal husbandry and crop farming in order to earn more money for her family. 

With the goal of future business development, Atyrbubu turned to the micro-finance bank Bai Tushum and Partner for a 55,000 som loan, with which she plans to purchase fertilizer and fuel. Atyrbubu intends to invest the extra income in future development of her business. She dreams of building a new home with modern comforts.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Aijan

texts.ru: Айжан  – участник группы «Ийгилик -3», ей 30 лет, мать 3 детей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Айжан обрабатывает землю с фасолью и картофелем и разводит скот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айжан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка одного бычка и закуп горюче-смазочных материалов на весенне-полевые работы.  Доходы от кредита Айжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, и планирует построить новый сарая для  скота.
texts.en:
Aijan is a member of the group "Iigilik -3". She is a 30-year-old mother of three. As the main source of income for her family, Aijan farms beans and potatoes in addition to raising cattle. 

With the goal of future business development, Aijan turned to the micro-finance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a 50,000 loan, with which she plans to purchase a steer and fuel for spring planting. She intends to invest the extra income in future development of her business and to build a new barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase bull calf and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fabric and threads.

loans.name: Edis María

texts.es:
Edis María de 54 años de edad, cansada de las humillaciones que sufría por parte de sus compañeros de trabajo decidió retirarse y montar su propio negocio dedicado a prestar el servicio de billar como medio de entretenimiento y a la venta de refrescos y mecatos. Gracias a su negocio su familia puede contar un una vivienda digna y una buena alimentación. 
Con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y aumentar sus ventas, Edis se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido.
Su mayor sueño es poder expandir su negocio y convertirse en una fuente e empleo para su localidad.
texts.en:
Edis María is 54 years old and when she grew tired from the teasing she received from her work colleagues, she decided to retire and open her own business dedicated to billiards and entertainment as well as the sales of soft drinks and pastries. Thanks to her business her family can live a dignified life and be well fed. 
With the goal of improving her economic situation and to increase sales, Edis is looking for a loan that she will invest in purchasing more stock. Her biggest dream is to expand her business and to convert it into a space for employment opportunities in her community.

loans.use: purchase soft drinks and pastries.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Сафаргул жительница города Куляб. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. Сафаргул является матерью шестерых детей. У нее трое дочерей и трое сыновей. Муж Сафаргул находится на заработках за рубежом. Старшая дочь Сафаргул помогает ей в ее деятельности и учиться вышивать. Двое ее сыновей занимается торговлей DVD дисков и мобильных сим-карт. Трое других детей учатся в средней школе. 
Сафаргул на протяжении пятнадцати лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев (чакан) и тюбетеек для продажи. Это искусства переходит от поколения к поколению. Сама Сафаргул научилась вышивать у своей матери. Теперь она занимается этим видом деятельности и учит свою дочь. 
Сафаргул берет кредит для приобретения электронной швейной машинки, чтобы легче была шить и сэкономить время. Таким образом у нее останется побольше свободной времени, чтобы вышивать тюбетеек, так как тюбетейки являются ручной работой.
texts.en:
Safargul is a 48-year-old resident of Kulob and a married mother of six. She has three daughters and three sons. Her husband works abroad. Safargul's oldest daughter helps her mother with work and is learning to embroider. Two of Safargul's sons sell DVDs and SIM cards. Her other three children are in high school. 

For 15 years Safargul has sewn and sold national dresses (chakan) and skullcaps. This craft has been passed down from generation to generation. Safargul learned to embroider from her mother. Now this craft is her profession and she is teaching her own daughter. 

Safargul is requesting a loan to purchase an electric sewing machine in order to make her sewing easier and to save time. This will give her more free time to embroider skullcaps, which are sewn by hand.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine in order to ease her work and save time

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира жизнерадостная, добрая и отзывчивая женщина в возрасте 42 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих замечательных детей. После окончания средней школы Нодира не смогла получить высшее образование, в связи с финансовыми трудностями в семье. Но она закончила профессиональное  училище, и получила профессию швеи. С тех пор она занимается шитьём у себя дома, и учит этому делу своих дочерей. Но также у неё есть постоянная работа, которая приносит ей доход, она работает в Дехканском хозяйстве. Раньше её муж также вместе с ней работал в Дехканском хозяйстве, но получаемой заработной платы не хватало на достойное обеспечение семьи, после чего он  решил поехать в Россию на заработки, как делают  многие мужчины из его посёлка. Он получает стабильный заработок и посылает его своей жене. Также в семье работает старший сын, он  работает плотником, но его работа сезонная и поэтому доход от этого дела бывает не всегда. Нодира со своей семьёй живут в старом доме, который достался ей от её родителей. Состояние этого дома ухудшается с каждым годом, на это  влияют также природные явления, частые дожди и снега, крыша требует капитального ремонта. Все члены семьи Нодиры старались накопить денег на ремонт дома, но никак не получается собрать нужное количество денежных средств. Поэтому Нодира хочет получить кредит, на который они купят все необходимые материалы для капитального ремонта этого дома. Она решила обратится за финансовой поддержкой  в Арванд и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Norida is a kind, cheerful, and helpful 42-year-old woman. She is married and has three wonderful children. Financial difficulties in her family prevented Norida from attending university after finishing high school. However, she completed a trade school for sewing. Since then she has worked as a seamstress from her home. She also teaches her daughters. 

Although this job brings her a steady income, Norida also works on a dekhan farm. Her husband also used to work with her on a dekhan farm, but the income was not enough to provide for their family comfortably. Hence, he decided to go to work in Russia just as many men from their village do. In Russia, he receives a regular salary that he sends to his wife. Norida's oldest son also works for the family. He is a carpenter, but his work is seasonal and therefore he does not always have an income. 

Norida and her family live in an old house that was passed down to her by her parents. Every year the condition of the house worsens. The weather, especially frequent rain and snow, effects the condition of the house. The roof is in need of a major renovation. All of the members of Norida's family tried to save money for a home renovation, but they simply could not manage to gather the necessary funds. Hence, Norida is requesting a loan, with which she will purchase the necessary materials for a major home renovation. She decided to turn to Arvand for financial assistance and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase clothing, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Arouna

texts.fr:
Monsieur Arouna est âgé de 41 et père de 2 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Il a fréquenté l’école moderne pendant des années puis il l’abandonne en classe de 5 ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) au profit des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté  plusieurs activités notamment la vente de chaussures, de tissus et des articles divers de  boutique, mais sans réussite. C’est ainsi qu’il décide d’accompagner son ami pour apprendre l’achat  vente de céréales.
Avec une expérience de plus de 5 années, il maîtrise son activité, qu’il  mène dans le grand marché de Bougouni et dans le autres marchés hebdomadaires. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un ami, il décida de collaborer avec l’institution avec qui  il est à son quatrième prêt et tous les trois prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés Il compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt, 2 tonnes de maïs, 1,5 tonne de petit mil. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants.  Ces clients sont surtout des commerçants de la place. 
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Arouna is 41 years old and father to two children. He lives with his wife and children in a nuclear family in the Hérémakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni. 

He attended a modern school for a number of years but left in fifth grade (of the Mali education system) of elementary school in order to launch an income generating activity. He tried several activities such as selling shoes, fabrics and various shop items, but without success. As a result he decided to join forces with his friend to learn how to buy and sell cereals. With more than five years' experience, he is now an expert in this business, which he carries out in Bougouni's Grand Market as well as in other weekly markets. He learnt about Soro Yiriwaso through a friend and decided to join the institution; he is now on his fourth loan, and the previous three loans he had have been repaid in full. With this new loan he is planning to buy two tons of corn and one and a half tons of pearl millet. He gets his supplies in Bougouni and the surrounding villages. His customers are mainly local traders. With this loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 80,000FCFA, which will be used to repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Djelika

texts.fr:
Madame Djelika est une femme mariée de 31 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne très vite elle commença à mener des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle a suivi sa sœur pour apprendre l’activité d’achat et de vente des condiments. Avec une expérience de plus de 6 ans, elle maitrise cette activité. 
Elle est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et les deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Dans le cadre de l’élargissement de ses activités, elle décida de prendre un autre prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 1 carton de concentrée de  tomate,  6 paquets de cube maggi,  2 sacs de sel de cuisine, 20 kilos d’oignon et 1 seau de pâte d’arachide. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni et la vente se fait chez elle même à domicile à une clientèle diverse et variée. Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle aidera son époux dans les dépenses, payera les intérêts du prêt et réinvestira dans son entreprise.
texts.en:
Djelika is a married woman who is 31 years old and mother to four children. She lives with her husband and children in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni. 

She did not attend school and at an early age began to carry out income-generating activities. She followed in her sister's footsteps and learnt how to buy and sell condiments. She is now an expert in this business with over six years of experience. 

She is on her third loan from Soro Yiriwaso and the previous two loans were repaid in full. In order to expand her business she decided to take out another loan from Soro Yiriwaso so that she can buy a carton of tomato puree, six packets of "Maggi" stock cubes, two bags of kitchen salt, 20 kilos of onions and a bucket of groundnut paste.

She gets her supplies from Bougouni's Grand Market and sells her products from home to a diverse customer base. With the help of this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 45,000FCFA. With this profit she will help her husband with expenses, pay the interest on her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Norita has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Norita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish net for her fishing business.

Norita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net for her business.

loans.name: Marie Catherine

texts.fr:
Marie Catherine est une femme membre de banc villageois. Elle est âgée de 61 ans. Elle est  mariée et mère de 5 enfants  dont 2 garçons. son activité principal est le commerce; Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 10 sacs de niandam (ressemble a des haricots que l'ont fait bouillir avec un peu de sel) a 20000f l'unité pour revendre ça dans tous  les marchés environnants par cuillerée de 25 francs cfa. Elle compte acheter aussi 10 porcs a 25000f l'unité pour faire de l'embouche et 320000f pour aliments bétail.Elle a une bonne expérience dans ces activités et y gagne bien sa vie. 
Avec ses bénéfices elle assure les dépenses de la maison et fait ses épargnes dans le banc villageois.
texts.en: Marie-Catherine is a female member of the Banc Villageois. She is 61 years old, married and mother to five children, two of whom are boys. Her main activity is trading. With her loan she is planning to buy ten sacks of niandam (which resemble beans that you boil with a little salt) at 20,000 francs each, which she will sell in all the surrounding markets for 25 francs per spoonful. She is also planning to buy ten pigs for fattening at 25,000 francs each and 320,000 francs worth of food for livestock. She has good experience in these activities and makes a good living out of them. With her profits she will be able to cover her household expenses and save money in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of "niandam" for 200,000 francs, 10 pigs for 250,000 francs, 20 sacks of livestock food for 300,000 francs and 10 bowls of left-overs for pigs for 20,000 francs.

loans.name: Lenelyn

texts.en:
Lenelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. She earns more income from selling native products.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 64 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like soap, canned goods, bread, soft drinks, etc.

She has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Lolita aspires to save money to expand her business and to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like soap, canned goods, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years now. She successfully fully paid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional assorted fish to sell. In the future, Iluminada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional assorted fish to sell.

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Luningning is 34 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. She has been in the poultry business for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her poultry. Luningning is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Mercy works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Mercy is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase equipment for her fishing business, like fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her fishing business, like fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita, 37, is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.

Norlita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Norlita has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Norlita requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Norlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Olay

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Olay works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising cows.  

Olay is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fruits to sell for her buy-and-sell fruits business.

Olay has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is 36 years old. She lives in Khutsubani village, Kobuleti district, with her 42-year-old husband, retired mother in-law and two children (5 and 8 years old). 

Irina has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.
 
The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a plot of land where nut, mandarin and persimmon trees are grown. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets. The family's additional income is Irina’s mother in-law's monthly pension.
  
Irina requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Irina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Irina will purchase car-painting equipment. She already has built a small commercial space where she plans to open a new business and paint the cars. Irina and her husband will work on this business themselves. They will not have to pay a salary to somebody else. This will decrease the expenses and increase the family profit. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase car-painting equipment.

loans.name: Germaine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui font toutes du commerce;ledit groupe est a son 22ème prêt. Germaine, la représentante est âgée de 56 ans mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 6 filles de 28;26;24;20;17 ans et un garçon de 34 ans.Elle a levé sa main sur la photo.
  Son activité principal est l'embouche de porc dans son domicile, elle fait aussi du commerce de pagne depuis plus d'un an.
  Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 5 porcs a 8000f chacun pour embouche; 10 pagnes à 12500f chacun et un gros porc de 60000f pour l'abattre et vendre la viande.elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine et malgré la concurrence dans le quartier elle arrive a s'en sortir.
Avec ses bénéfices elle arrive épargner tout mois dans le banc villageois ; elle paie aussi le scolarité de ses enfants et la nourriture parfois
texts.en:
This group is made up of five women who are all traders. The group is on its 22nd loan. 

Germaine, who is the representative of the group, is 56 years old, married and mother to seven children: six girls who are respectively 28, 26, 24, 20 and 17 years old and one 34-year old boy. She is the one with her hand raised in the photo. 

Her main activity is fattening pigs at her home but she has also been selling "pagnes" for more than a year. With her loan she is planning to buy five pigs at 8,000 francs each, ten "pagnes" at 12,500 francs each and a large pig for 60,000 francs which she will kill and sell the meat. She has good experience in this field and despite competition in the area she manages to get by. With the profits she makes she will manage to put by savings in the Banc Villageois every month. She will also pay for her children's schooling and sometimes food.

loans.use: to buy ten traditional "pagnes" for 125,000 francs, five pigs for 40,000 francs and another pig for 60,000 francs.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Coiffeuse et tresseuse de profession, Afi vit avec son conjoint et leurs 02 enfants (13 et 09ans) à Lomé. Après sa formation, Afi a ouvert son atelier en 2004. En plus de son activité, elle  revend des pommades et des mèches  c’est justement pour investir dans l’achat des marchandises qu’elle sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES.  Elle espère agrandir son activité et assurer l’avenir des enfants. Notons qu'elle est âgée de 32ans.
texts.en: Afi is a hairdresser and hair braider by trade, and she lives with her husband and two children (13 and nine years old respectively) in Lomé. After her training, Afi opened her hair salon in 2004. As well as this business, she also sells creams and hair extensions, and she is requesting a first loan from WAGES to invest in these products. She hopes to expand her business and ensure her children's future. It should be noted that she is 32 years old.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Fransina

texts.en:
Fransina is a 42-year-old lady, married to Imanuel, a 45-year-old man. They have four children: Afriani, 14, 2nd grade of Junior High School; Oriyanti, 12, 5th grade of Elementary School; Lucky, 9, 3rd grade of Elementary School; and Michael, 6. 

Fransina is running a kiosk business, selling household items such as sugar, coffee, detergent, cigarettes, bath soap, mosquito coils, snacks and soft drinks. She initiated the business to help meet the needs of the family because her husband works as a construction worker.

The increase in market price and the demand for more stock from the customers led Fransina to seek more money to buy various items. She then submitted a loan application and requested a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000. She plans to spend the loan on more snacks and soft drinks. She hopes that her loan application will be approved soon.

loans.use: to buy various items.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Milagros works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains. 

Milagros is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell for her buy-and-sell dried fish business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Narcefa

texts.en:
Narcefa is 46 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains and dried coconut meat. Narcefa has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 57 years old and married. She has five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rebecca has been farming vegetables for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming coconut.

Rebecca is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 31 years old. He lives in the small village of Mtskheta district with his wife and mother. 

Irakli has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays the family has no source of income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Irakli requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Irakli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Irakli will purchase a car. After purchasing a car he will be able to serve local people as a taxi driver and earn income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nida works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising ducks. Nida is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Nogrina

texts.en:
Nogrina is married with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has four children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, Nogrina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 42 years old and married. She has three children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, spices, etc.

Victoria has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Victoria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, spices, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ambulant vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Virginia has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from selling native products at retail.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items of vegetables like eggplant, garlic, carrots, baguio beans, cabbage, etc., to sell in her ambulant vegetable-vending business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like eggplant, garlic, carrots, baguio beans, cabbage, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 48 years old and married. She has ten children.

Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells nipa, woven palm mats used for house repair and construction, in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa to sell.

Wilma has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa business for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

Wilma aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa to sell.

loans.name: Zamir

texts.en:
Zamir is 36 years old. He lives in the Chakvi district with his 22-year-old wife and retired mother. Zamir requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. He is a car artisan and he works on private orders to earn a small monthly salary. Additional family income is Zamir’s mother’s monthly pension. The total income of the family is rarely enough for covering their monthly expenses.
 
Zamir requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Zamir will open a car service center. He will rent a commercial space and buy all the needed equipment to start the business. As Zamir is already very experienced in this field and he is well known among the villagers, he hopes his new business will be successful. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To open a car service center.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 26 years old. He lives in the Kutaisi district with his father, Irodi. Mikheil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family owns a commercial space which they are renting out. This is the only income for the family and it’s rarely enough for food for them.

Mikheil requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this credit, Mikheil will purchase all the needed materials to produce lemonade. He has already bought a lemonade workshop and mounting for starting the business. Now he needs to buy bottles, stickers and all the other materials to start producing lemonade. Mikheil and his father will work very hard to make their business profitable. Mikheil will use part of the profit to reinvest in the same business and another part for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase all the needed materials to produce lemonade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electrical cables inside the home.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhjargal, 32 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2009, and has accumulated necessary experiences like where and how to pick up customers and shorten trips. Before this job, he worked as a cook, between 2005 and 2009. 

His elder son goes to kindergarten while his two-year-old younger son, together with his mother, stays at home. The family resides in a rental house on rented land. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase furniture such as a sofa and a wardrobe. These items will make the house more comfortable and he will work more enthusiastically. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as a sofa and a wardrobe.

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en: Myassar is a 47-year-old divorced woman. She works at fabric embroidery to make a living. She wants to enhance her business, so she applied for a loan to buy new embroidery tools for her business.

loans.use: to buy new embroidery tools for her business.

loans.name: Assiagbon

texts.fr: Meunier de profession, Assiagbon est un jeune homme de 28ans qui se bat chaque fois pour gagner son pain quotidien. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, il désire implanter un moulin électrique c’est pour cela, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Comme perspectives d‘avenir, il espère multiplier d’autres points de service et se marier plus tard.
texts.en:
A miller by trade, Assiagbon is a young 28-year-old man who battles each day to earn a living. To better respond to the needs of his customers, he wants to install an electric mill. And it is for this that he is asking for his first loan with WAGES. 

In the future, he hopes to expand his business to other locations and also get married.

loans.use: to pay the estimate for the installation of an electric mill

loans.name: Evelio De Jesús

texts.es:
Evelio de 54 años de edad, se ha dedicado a su taller de bicicletas, en donde además de ofrecer sus servicios de mantenimiento, vende repuestos y accesorios.
Labora diariamente de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche  en jornada continua. Gracias a su trabajo hoy su familia goza de mejores condiciones de vida. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de tener un stock y no disminuirlas ventas. 
Espera seguir creciendo y posicionarse en el mercado local como el número uno.
texts.en:
Evelio, 54, makes her living in a bicycle workshop where as well as offering maintenance services he also sells tires and accessories. He works every day continuously from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm at night. It is thanks to his work that his family enjoys better living conditions today. 

Evelio is currently seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of goods so as to have stock and not lose out on sales. He hopes to continue growing and set up in a local market as the number 1 bicycle store.

loans.use: to buy bicicyle tires and accessories.

loans.name: Sowoe

texts.en:
Sowoe is 35 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the highly populated areas in Montserrado County. She is living together with her fiancee and two children, aged 1 and 15. They all live at home and only the 15-year-old attends school. Sowoe stopped her education at grade 9, but she is good at managing her business. Her fiancee is a taxi driver. 

For the past three years she has been selling rice, pepper, oil, cold water, etc. in the local market. She sells every day and spends 12 hours each day with her business. She started this business with a little money she received from her fiancee. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, cold water, etc. for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, cold water, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Philimetta

texts.en: Philimetta is 35 years old and live in Paynesville, one of the populate areas in Montserrado County. She is living with her fiancee and her 3-year-old child. For the past three years, she has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She requests a loan to purchase more inventory (cups, plates, bowls, etc.) for her business. Philimetta plans to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory including cups, plates, and bowls for her business

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor María de 30 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a  las labores del campo y gracias a su padre aprendió de la ganadería. Actividad de la cual hoy vive. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano e inicia su faena ordeñando las vacas y posteriormente vende la leche entre sus vecinos. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que de desea invertir en la compra de ganado de levante con el fin de aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar.
Sueña con brindarles a sus hijos de nueve y dos años de edad un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Flor María, 30, is a mother to two children. She has spent her whole life making a living working the land and thanks to her father she learnt about cattle, an activity which she exercises today. Every day, she gets up very early and starts her day milking the cows and then going on to sell the milk to her neighbors.

At this moment in time, she is seeking a loan which she hopes to invest in the purchase of cattle for rearing with the aim of increasing her milk production and improve her household's financial situation. Flor María dreams of giving her children, aged 2- and 9-years-old, a better future.

loans.use: to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.name: Penneyou

texts.en:
Penneyou lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populous areas in Montserrado County. She is 43 years old, and she is married with seven children between the ages of 1 and 25. Only six of her children are currently in school and live at home. For ten years, she has been selling cassava, fish, etc., in the local market. She started this business with a little money received from her husband. She enjoys the buying from her customers and the money that she generates from her business.

Penneyou is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava, fish, etc., to enlarge her sales. She plans to build a house and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, fish, etc., to enlarge her sales

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is 53 years old. He lives in the village of Gora, Vani District, with his retired brother and sister and nephew. Pridon has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up without any success. His loan requests are rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The main source of income for this family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows, a vineyard and a plot of land where nut trees and vegetables are grown. The cows are milked every day to make dairy products. Harvested vegetables and grapes are sold with the dairy products locally at the markets and the family earns a small monthly income.

Pridon requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Pridon has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit, Pridon will purchase all the needed materials to build a greenhouse. With the greenhouse, he will be able to sell vegetables not only in summer but wintertime too. This will significantly increase the family income. With the increased income, Pridon will be able to expand his agricultural business and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy many cases of beer and fizzy lemonade to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE”  iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de conejo, tienda de barrio, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido a máquina; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Flor Naciente communal bank will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Focal Center.  It is comprised of nine members and is headed by a board with Verónica as the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied.  Among them are selling food, selling fish, selling rabbits, a neighborhood store, and selling CDs.

The loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Verónica.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three and a half years.  She joined by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She has a business of weaving by machine.  She learned this business by her own initiative.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy wool).  She will get the wool from wholesalers in the city of La Paz.  She will later sell what she makes at the space where she sells.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health trainings and the loans.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 39 years old and lives in the Paynesville city which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is living together with her fiancee; the two of them have four children between 11 and 19 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past eight years Comfort has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes lots of profit and has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business; her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Ioseb

texts.en:
Ioseb is 42 years old. He lives in a small village of Gori District with his wife and three children. Ioseb requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where maize is grown. They sell harvested produce locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ioseb requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Ioseb has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Ioseb and his wife will begin selling clothes. They will purchase clothes from the wholesalers and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to begin  selling clothes

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu lives in Paynesville. She is 35 years old and single with two children aged 4 and 12, which are in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling artificial hair. Bendu says that she is proud of her business because of her daily savings, and she started this business with a small amount from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair to expand her business. In the future she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair to expand her business.

loans.name: Vano

texts.en:
Vano is 22 years old. He lives in Anaga village, Sighnagi district with his retired grandparents. Vano requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
Vano is a professional car painter. He is working on private orders and earns a small salary. The family receives additional income from Vano’s grandparent’s monthly pensions.
Vano requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Vano has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Vano will purchase four piglets. He will raise them and soon sell them at a higher price at the local markets. This will help him to earn a good profit. Part of the profit he will reinvest to develop his farming. Another part he will use for the family’s well-being. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 39 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married with 4 children between 8 and 18 years old, who are currently in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling pepper, rice and palm oil at the local market. She spends 10 hours a day, six days a week with her business. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice and palm oil for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Caritas Felices Group

texts.es: El grupo “Caritas Felices”  está conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y comprometidas con el programa, siendo la gran mayoría de ellas vecinas de la zona. María cuenta con una tienda en su vivienda, este negocio comenzó gracias a la motivación de su familia y los deseos de mejorar su economía. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo ha podido implementar su tienda. María nos comenta que a pesar de las competencias ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes.  María de 26 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos menores de edad. Solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, la cual compró abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. Seguir mejorando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Caritas Felices” está agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues eso le permite seguir mejorando cada día. María es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo rojo y pantalón negro.
texts.en: El grupo “Caritas Felices”  está conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y comprometidas con el programa, siendo la gran mayoría de ellas vecinas de la zona. María cuenta con una tienda en su vivienda, este negocio comenzó gracias a la motivación de su familia y los deseos de mejorar su economía. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo ha podido implementar su tienda. María nos comenta que a pesar de las competencias ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes.  María de 26 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos menores de edad. Solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, la cual compró abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. Seguir mejorando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Caritas Felices” está agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues eso le permite seguir mejorando cada día. María es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo rojo y pantalón negro.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy butter, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, meat, sausages, tomato sauce, spaghetti, fizzy drinks, milk, sugar, coffee, beans, bread and so on for her business.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan habitante del municipio de Masaya, junto a su esposa e hijos han trabajado duro para salir adelante, su  mayor sueño es mejorar de condiciones para tener un mejor fututo, el es comerciante de Frutas y verduras, en los departamentos del pais desde hace mas de 15 años, su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de Ropa y Zapatos, con este credito comprara Materiales de Construccion como: Piedras Cantera, Cemento, Hiero, Viaje de Arena, Zinc y Bloques con esto podra continuar con la construccion de su casa, Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado al otorgarle este credito.
texts.en: Juan, a resident of Masaya municipality, lives with his wife and children. They have worked hard to move forward. His greatest dream is to improve conditions to have a better future. He has sold fruits and vegetables in departments in the country for more than 15 years. His wife helps him with household expenses, since she has her own business selling clothing and shoes. With this loan, he will buy construction materials like quarried stone, cement, iron, a truckload of sand, corrugated metal roofing, and cinderblocks. With these, he can continue construction on his home. He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have given him upon providing him with this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 57 years old. He lives in Oni District with his children (25-year-old daughter Ekaterine and 20-year-old son Ivane). Guram requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Guram’s wife is working abroad and she sends transfers to the family. His daughter Ekaterine is an administrator in a food production company in the capital city. Guram’s son Ivane is an invalid and he gets monthly pension from the government. As Ivane needs special care, family monthly income is rarely enough to cover their food expenses.

Guram requested a loan from Credo to re-start up the family business. Guram has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Guram will purchase liquid gas. He had this business before and still has the gas container so Guram wants’ to start up the business again. He will be filling up the small gas cannisters (which are used for mainly for cooking) for his villagers who don’t have piped gas systems in their houses. 

Guram is experienced in this business and he hopes he can make it successful and earn good profit.  Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same field to purchase more liquid gas and with another part he will provide better living conditions for his son.

loans.use: To purchase liquid gas

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 46 years old and lives in  Paynesville which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a driver. The two of them have a 14-year-old child, who is currently in school and lives at home.

For the past eleven years Sarah has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She makes lots of profit and has a lot of customers since her business is in  a very good location. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
Ia is 28 years old. She lives in a small village of Mtskheta District with husband Kakhaber and two children who go to school. Ia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown for selling. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ia requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Ia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her loan Ia will pay for installation of electricity cables in their car workshop. The family owns a car workshop located near their house, but it is not in use. After they have electricity in their workshop, Kakhaber himself  will work and will get orders to repair cars. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to pay for installation of electricity cables

loans.name: Marika

texts.en:
Marika is 23 years old. She lives in Kutaisi district, West Georgia, with her retired mother. Marika requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Marika is working in a kindergarten as a dance teacher and her mother is working at a military base as a cook. Additional family income comes from their flower business. They have a flower shop in the center of the city.

Marika requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Marika has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Marika will purchase more flowers for her shop. She wants to expand the business to have a wider assortment of lowers to offer to the clients. This will grow the number of clients and also the income of the family. With part of the profit, Marika wants to renovate their house to have better living conditions. Another part will be reinvested in her business to expand it more.

loans.use: To purchase more flowers for her flower shop

loans.name: Elgun

texts.en:
Elgun is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and now lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. He is 23 years old. Elgun started his business three months ago raising cattle. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan  to repair the stall so it can hold more cattle. He wants to use the money from his new business to help buy more calves to improve his business. 

In the future, Elgun wants to have a big farm for calves. This will be a more profitable business. Elgun wants to get married as soon as he has a stable monthly income . Elgun is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him in this new business.

loans.use: to repair the stall for cattle

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 45-year-old woman. After her husband's retirement he started working as a taxi driver to be able to support his children now that some of them are university students. For that reason, Siham is applying for an educational loan this time to help her husband and children pay their semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her children's semester fees.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: Iqbal is a 21-year-old married lady; she still has no kids. While staying at home, Iqbal started selling blankets last winter which brought them some additional income that was used in completing some house furniture. She is now applying for a youth loan to add more lighter bed covers that are suitable for summer use to her inventory.

loans.use: to add to her inventory more lighter bed covers that are suitable for summer use

loans.name: Rewa

texts.en:
Rewa is a 31-year-old conservative woman; her husband Shaher took her place in the photo. 

Rewa is a mother of two kids. While staying at home, she started working as a basic hair stylist from home for female neighbors and friends. She uses her own hair dryer and brush. 

Now Rewa is applying for a loan to enhance the business and purchase new hair brushes and another hair dryer and a straighter. She also want to start selling make-up products, too.

loans.use: to purchase new hair brushes and another hair dryer and a straighter, and to start selling make-up products

loans.name: Karamat

texts.en: Karamat is 48 years old, married, and has three children: 18-year-old and 16-year-old daughters and a 14-year-old son. His daughters and son go to school. He wants his daughters to become doctors. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. Karamat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his wife and children. He started his business four years ago, selling corn, wheat, grain, etc. Now Hidjran needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy stock. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his family. In the future, Karamat wants to expand the area of his shop. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat, and grain to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 40 years old. He lives in a small village in Kaspi District with his mother and brother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Davit has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up without any success. His loan requests are rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Davit works as an artisan in a plastic factory. He produces different kinds of plastic products and earns a small monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Davit requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Davit has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

Davit will purchase piglets with his credit. He plans to raise them and resell them after a few months for a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for resale

loans.name: Mays

texts.en: Mays is a 20-year-old university student. She has once before applied for an educational loan that helped her in paying her university fees. Now she is applying for another loan to pay the next semester’s fees, as she is working on getting her bachelor's degree in banking and finance as soon as she can.

loans.use: to pay her university registration fees for the semester.

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh lives in Paynesville, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 48 years old, unmarried, and has three children, ages from 23 to 31. For the past seven years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She started this business with a small amount received from her fiancé. She enjoys her customers’ buying and the money that she generates from her business. She is applying for a loan to buy more charcoal to sell. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh was able to enter the market by selling her hand-made embroidered dresses to a few clothing shops, where she started to get special orders. Now Fatmeh is applying again for another loan to buy more embroidery threads, as well as plain women’s dresses to which she can add some artistic handmade embroidery art and then sell them.

loans.use: to buy more embroidery threads, as well as plain women's dresses to which she will add artistic embroidery.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a mother for 6 children. 

Iman has her own tailoring workshop where she sews used clothes and tailors new ones. It has been two years since she opened the business. Now Iman is applying for a loan to buy a new sewing machine and a plotting machine to improve the quality of clothes she makes.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a plotting machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa is a 35-year-old married woman. Her husband is serving in the military while she looks after their son and daughter. Sharifa also sells some types of home products at home, mostly kitchenware, to her female neighbors and friends. She is applying for a loan to increase the amount of home products that she has, adding variety to it like decoration pieces.

loans.use: to bring more home products and decoration pieces to sell

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is 54 years old. She lives in Matani village, Akhmeta district with her 25-year-old son, David. Asmat requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the income for the family is David’s salary. He is working at the local mail office and earns a small monthly salary.  

Asmat requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Asmat has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Asmat will start trading with clothes. She will purchase clothes at the wholesale price from the big market in the capital city, bring them to her district and sell to her villagers with a price markup. This will give her an opportunity to earn additional income for the family and provide better living conditions.

loans.use: To start trading with clothes

loans.name: Chojña Pampita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHOJÑA PAMPITA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eusebia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, comerciante de refrescos, tractorista, venta de abarrotes, venta de queso, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eusebia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías en trenzado de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que ella desde hace varios años lo realiza.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la feria de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que el cobro lo realizan en su pueblo. 

En la fotografía hace falta una señora que tuvo que ir a ver su ganado.
texts.en:
The “CHOJÑA PAMPITA” communal bank is starting its second round with Pro Mujer, as part of the central focus on Patacamaya. It's made up of 8 members and is directed by a board of directors presided by Eusebia. The businesses that the members run vary and include: weaving blankets, selling soft drinks, tractor driving, selling groceries, cheeses or having a grocery shop.   

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners that Eusebia presides. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago after a promoter from the institution visited her home and invited her to get involved. At present, she has a crafts business, weaving blankets. She learnt this trade from her mother and has been doing it for several years. 
 
The loan that she is taking out is to increase her capital (buy wool) which she will purchase from the markets in the city of El Alto. After making them she will sell them in her community's market. This work allows her to generate resources to be able to maintain her home as she is married with seven children.  

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes that payments take place within her town. 

There is one woman missing in the photograph who had to go check her herd.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, de 53 años,esta casado con Gisela y tiene 2 hijos. El trabajo de Wilfredo consiste en la siembra de productos agrícolas que son yuca, maíz, cacao, palma aceitera. Este trabajo lo realiza en sus terrenos cultivo , lleva 10 años en esta actividad y le esta yendo bien ya que en este tiempo la producción agrícola tiene un alza en el mercado nacional y  son requeridos a nivel internacional.
