Now, her requested loan amount is 3,600,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy rice seed, potash, and gasoline to pump water for the farm. She hopes to earn more income so she can upgrade her living condition into a prosperous condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, potash, and gasoline to pump water for the farm.

loans.name: Cheour's Group

texts.en:
A 55-year-old widowed mother of nine children, Chhoeur is a cultivator who does rice-cropping and cassava farming. She has been with the current business for 20 years, earning about 33,000 KHR per day.

 This is not the first loan for Chhoeur with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  After the successful past seven loans that she has repaid completely, she feels confident that she can better support her business in a timely manner. 

For this cycle, Choeur leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 4,800,000 KHR. Chhoeur, as the group leader and whose loan portion is 1,000,000 KHR, will spend her loan portion to plow her cassava farm. 

She highly hopes that she can earn more income from her cash-crop so that she can set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee for her cassava.

loans.name: Bunsat's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Bunsat is 44 years old and married. She is blessed with three children. Bunsat, with support from her husband, depends solely on rice-growing on a seven-hectare area. She has been involved in this for ten years. 

Bunsat is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has completely repaid, has uplifted her living in a steady manner, especially in providing decent meals three times daily for her kids. 

Now, she is in need of working capital to support her farmland. Hence, she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, Bunsat will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice on time and make a good yield and high income.

loans.use: to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Burenbuyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Burenbuyn, 35 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

Burenbuyn has been working as an accountant at a private business entity since 2006, and is considered to be one of the skilled staff by company managers. Her husband has been rendering taxi services to local people for six years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in where to pick up customers and how to shorten routes. 

Burenbuyn and her husband began building a house on their land last autumn. They completed the main components of the house, but due to lack of finances, they haven't finished their house. Living in a house is way better than living in a ger for comfort and warmth. During the harsh wintertime, they burn tons of coal in order to heat their Mongolian traditional ger. 

So, Burenbuyn is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using these building materials, she and her husband can finish their house and after that, insulate their house with fiberglass. The resulting high-quality house will enable the family to burn less coal, release less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who doesn't want her husband or son to chill down to their cores during the harsh wintertime.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Age 32 and a farmer from Kampong Cham province, Nan is 32 years old and has three dependent schoolchildren. She and the rest of her family count on agricultural activities: cassava and rice farming. Her 10 year engagement in the current business has returned her about 24,400 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Nan’s group, consisting of two females.  She and her joint member are seeking for 500,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and labor costs, and to buy potash and insecticide. She highly hopes that she can gain a high yield with a good income.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and labor costs and to buy potash and insecticide

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is married and has five children. She is 58 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store, selling grocery products such as noodles, spices, canned goods, laundry and bath soap, and soft drinks. She has run this business for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000.

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to acquire additional grocery products to sell. Merlinda joined GDMPC in 2007. She hopes to expand and improve her business, to gain more income for the family and create a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to acquire additional grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Dalin's Group

texts.en:
Dalin is a 40-year-old, married mother of two children. They are dependent on her and still in school. Dalin and her family live in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district, Battambang province. She and her husband are nurses, who work in the local area. They have been working in this field for ten years. She and her husband are able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day, to meet the family’s needs.
 
Dalin has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles, and she has completely paid back the past loans. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her family and her children’s education. Now, she is leading her group of four to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets for raising, to earn additional income for her family. She hopes this loan will let her fatten her pigs, so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising, to supplement the income she earns working as a nurse

loans.name: Mary Liseth

texts.es:
Mary de 24 años de edad, es una mujer con grandes retos y sueños por realizar. Cuenta  que su gran sueño fue ser educadora, pero no contaba con los recursos para ingresar a la  universidad, por lo cual optó por crear desde su casa una pequeña sala de internet y generar los recursos para pagar su carrera. Fue así como inició con la creación de su negocio.  Hoy lleva más de tres años realizando la actividad y se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de un computador, un play station, televisor y artículos de papelería con el fin de aumentar su portafolio de productos e incrementar sus ventas.
Espera poder terminar sus estudios, prestar su servicio a la comunidad y convertirse en una empresaria de éxito.
texts.en:
Mary is 24 years old. She is a woman with great challenges and dreams to achieve. She says that her big dream was to be an educator, but she did not have the means to go to university, so she choose to open a small Internet business in her home to generate the resources to pay for her career. And so she launched her business. She has been in business for more than three years and is requesting a loan in order to buy a computer, a play station, a TV set, and stationery in order to expand her merchandise and increase her sales.

She hopes to finish her studies, provide a service to the community and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a play station, a TV, and stationery products

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza is 49 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 9,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010. Now, she has requested a loan of 17,500 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase additional products to sell, like noodles, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo and canned goods. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like noodles, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo and canned goods.

loans.name: Diana Caridad

texts.es:
La señora Diana de 33 años de edad es soltera, vive con su madre y tiene  una hija   que depende de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de ropa nueva.
Doña Diana vende ropa y calzado para todas la edades, su clientela son las maestras, personas que laboran para la portuaria, amigos, familiares y personas que ha diario visitan su negocio.
Doña Diana se caracteriza por su buen trato hacia sus clientes y buena atención a sus clientes, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de ropa como blusas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas y calzonetas.
Doña Diana desea en especial comprar ropa para dama  porque se acerca el día de las madres y desea tener surtido para atender a sus clientas es por tal razón que solicita este crédito y así obtener mejores ganancias.
Doña Diana está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma y su sueño es abrir un nuevo negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Diana, 33, is single and lives with her mother.  She has a dependent daughter.  Diana lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the southern part of Honduras.  She has her own house, and has had a business selling new clothing for 10 years.

Diana sells clothing and shoes for all ages.  Her customers are teachers and people who work for the port, friends, relatives, and other people who visit her store daily.

Diana is known for her good service and good treatment that she provides to her customers.  She is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as: blouses, pants, dresses, skirts, shirts and bathing suits.  

Diana particularly wants to buy women's clothing, because Mother's Day is approaching and she wants to have her store well-stocked for her customers.  This is why she is requesting this loan, which will help her to obtain better earnings.

Diana is very content working with Prisma, and her dream is to open a new business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, dresses, skirts, shirts and bathing suits for her business

loans.name: Senkata 2012 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SENKATA 2012”  iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Erica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de deportivos por mayor, venta de productos por catálogos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de ropa, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Erica es integrante, ella indica que hace diez y siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con los ahorros que había te nido en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuadernos, estuches geométricos, bolígrafos, etc.) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Senkata 2012” will begin its 17th cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. It is made up of 9 members and is headed by a board where Erica is the President. 

The business that the members of the communal bank are in are varied and among them are: wholesale sales of sports items, catalog sales, neighborhood store, food sales, clothing sales, and bookstore.

The loan they are requesting will benefit the small microenterprises where Erica is a member. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 17 years, joining through the invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution. Today she has a bookstore; she discloses that she launched this business with the savings she had in her Pro Mujer nest.

The loan that she is asking for is to increase her capital (to buy notebooks, geometry sets, pens, etc.) buying from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later selling them in her sales outlet. This way of working allows her to generate resources to maintain her household as much as possible as she lives in a partnership and she has a daughter.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in health and credit.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, geometry sets, pens, etc.

loans.name: Samith's Group

texts.en:
Samith is 54 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Sangke district of Battambang province.  She has five children. 

Growing rice, oranges and Jackfruit are the main sources of her family’s income to make living.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  With the current business, she can earn approximately 45,000KHR per day and save about 15,000KHR each day for the future needs. 

Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver.  

This is the second micro loan for Samith with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  The other member has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles.  Samith completely repaid her loan and is the group leader.

Samith will use her portion to repair an old motorbike for her husband’s business.  She hopes this loan will enable her to repair it so he can provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to repair an old motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Saron, 34, is married with two children, residing in a rural village in the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia.  One child is dependent upon her and attends school. 

For the last fourteen years, Saron has been farming rice and growing cassava as primary sources of her family’s income.  Sometimes her husband works for others for a fee.  They can earn about 26,000KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.
 
Saron is with VisionFund for this loan cycle.  She is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor.  

Saron hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and fulfill her dream to have a decent home to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is married with four children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Diosdada is 44 years old and three of her children attend school.

Diosdada has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Diosdada has been in this business for two years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Choeung Prey district, Sokheng is 47 years old and married with five children. 

To make a living and support her big family, Sokheng and her husband have been farming rice for twenty years.  They are able to earn about 38,000KHR per day to meet their family’s needs.
  
This is the first micro loan for Sokheng’s group of four with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Each member is request a loan of 1,000,000KHR.  

Sokheng, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. 

With this loan, she hopes to cultivate more rice, earn more income in order to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Ry is aged 54 years and widowed with one son. She grows cassava as her main source of family income. She also supplements the income by selling grocery items. Ry has engaged in this business for three years, and she is able to earn about 24,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Ry is a first-cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and cassava seeds for her cassava-growing business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a large income so as to fulfill her dream of having a decent motorbike and extending her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cassava seeds for her cassava-growing business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Miguel Alfredo

texts.es: Don Miguel de 44 años de edad se dedica a la carpinteria desde hace varios años fabrica juegos de sala, roperos, gabeteros, entre otras cosas asi como muestra en la fotografia y con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar; vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 17, 16 y 14 años de edad actualmente estudian y su esposa vende en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, El solicita un credito que le permita comprar los materiales necesarios para elaborar los muebles como madera, clavos, barnis para pintarlos, cepilladora, entre otras cosas para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Miguel is 44 years old. He has been working as a carpenter for many years making living room sets, closets, cabinets, among other items as shown in the photograph and the sales he makes covers some of the household expenses. He lives in his own home with his wife and 3 children who are 17, 16, and 14 years old. They are students and his wife is a merchant in the market that is near their home. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy necessary supplies in order to make furniture such as wood, nails, varnish to paint them, brushes, among other things in order to obtain better earnings and give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy wood supplies, nails, varnish, etc.

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Ty is 31 years old and married with one daughter.  They live in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. 

For eleven years Ty and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and cassava.  To up more income, they also work as paid workers.  Their current business earns them about 15,000KHR per day.  And they save about 8,000KHR each day to meet future needs.
 
Ty’s group consists of two female members who are with VisionFund for this loan cycle.  As the leader, Ty wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for rice and cassava planting.  

She hopes to grow her rice and cassava successfully and increase her current income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice and cassava planting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sida's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Sida is a 47 year old, married mother of three children, one is dependent upon her and attends school. 

She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and planting rubber tree for twenty-eight years. They earns about 22,000KHR per day and save about 7,000KHR each day for future needs. 

This is group loan.  Sida’s group consists of two women and they are with VisionFund for this loan cycle.  Sida is the leader and will use her portion to buy fertilizers for applying to her rubber field. 

Sida hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rubber healthfully, so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 45 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, can goods, soft drinks, noodles, milk, etc..

Francisca has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure a good future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, can goods, soft drinks, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
Noun, 31, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. For the last 12 years, Noun and her husband have been working as paid workers in rubber fields to support their family. Together, they are able to earn approximately 12,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

Noun’s group consists of two females who live in the same village. They are in their first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Noun is now leading her group to ask for a loan. 

Noun will use her portion to buy a motorbike to use as transportation to commute to rubber fields and use a portion of it to spend on buying household supplies. Noun hopes this loan will help her and her husband get to work in a timely manner, and she also hopes to have enough household necessities for use by her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use as transportation to commute to rubber fields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lolita works hard to support her family.

Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more grocery items like soap, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, spices, sugar, and others to sell at her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and pig fattening business. Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like soap, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, spices, sugar, and other items to sell

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Myagmarsuren, 48 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own brick house on a plot of land. She has been working as an interior decorator for individuals or entities, on her own, on short-term employment contracts, for 30 consecutive years. Her husband is temporarily residing in another district, working on a construction site.

Her elder son has become employed as a salesman by a business entity, but the employer requires him to have an automobile, to be used for transporting products and meeting with potential clients. So Myagmarsuren is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT. She will use it to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. This natural gas car has cleaner emissions, with lower carbon and particulate emissions per equivalent distance traveled, and less fuel wastage. Purchasing this car will enable her son to secure his employment. It will also contribute to the efforts against air pollution, by emitting fewer harmful chemicals into the air.

The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who has a vast amount of experience in her job and a good reputation for her service.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas, for her son's use in his job as a salesman for a business entity

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar is35 years old and lives with his wife and father-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

His son studies in Korea on scholarship.  He and his wife have worked at sock factory for ten years and in 2010 they came back to Mongolia to run their own business. 

They have purchased a sock making machine and rented a basement apartment.  Using their accumulated experience in making socks, they successfully launched their business and clients are ordering more socks, but Ganbaatar can't afford to provide socks due to inventory shortage. 

So Ganbaatar is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to purchase materials such as wool, cotton and silk.  As a result, they can supply more socks to their clients and generate more income to improve their living standard. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wool, cotton and silk.

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Im is 49 years old and married.  She has five children. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been selling coconuts for thirty years and they supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. 

Their business earns them about 24,000KHR per day and they manages them to save about 12,000KHR each day for future needs.

This is the first micro loan for Im’s group consisting of two female members.  She is leading her group and requests a loan with VisionFund.  Im wants to use her portion to buy a motorbike to sell her coconuts. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Krem's Group

texts.en:
Krem is 53 years old and married with three children.  She lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. 

Like other villagers, rice farming and cassava planting have been Krem's main sources of income for 33 years. Her family’s daily income is about 23,000KHR.
 
Krem’s group consists of two members who are female.  She is its leader and her first microloan with VisionFund.  Krem wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and cassava seeds to cultivate her land. 

She hopes to grow her cassava fruitfully and healthily so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cassava seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 47 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a beauty salon in the local community, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 8,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2011. Now she has requested a loan of 12,500 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase additional beauty salon supplies. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house, and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Trinidad Magdalena

texts.es: Trinidad vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras: plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles, pepinos, papayas, sandias entre otros, tiene 5 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran sacar adelante a su familia, Trinidad desea realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor para obtener mas ganancias y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor vida sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en: Trinidad lives together with her husband and two children in their own home. She works selling fruits and vegetables: bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, chiles, peppers, papayas and watermelon, among others. She has worked in this business for 5 years, giving her a lot of experience with sales. The place where she sells her fruit is strategically located for this activity. Moreover, it is crowded with people. Today she has many customers who prefer her because her products are fresh, are offered at a good price, are high quality and she provides excellent service. With the earnings she makes, and with the help of her husband, she is able to get her family ahead. Trinidad wants to complete a new investment, but she does not have sufficient capital to support it. Because of this she is seeking a loan that will allow her to buy fruits and vegetables, primarily to obtain greater earnings and to be able to give her family a better life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: La Paz En Los Olivos Group

texts.es:
El grupo La paz en los Olivos está integrado por 07 socios, la mayoría vecinos del mismo lugar, uno de ellos es Germán el tesorero del grupo, quien durante mucho tiempo se dedico al negocio de la panadería lamentablemente no le fue bien teniendo que dejarlo, fue así que decidió ayudar a su esposa en su negocio  de comidas instalado en la puerta de su casa, poco a poco fue aprendiendo y hoy en día acaba de inaugurar su restaurante en un local muy céntrico. Germán está agradecido porque le va muy bien, sus asiduos comensales disfrutan los platos que preparan en su restaurante, allí trabaja junto a su esposa que es la cocinera, el se dedica a la atención del público y administra el negocio. Con el préstamo solicitado quiere mejorar su negocio comprando utensilios de cocina y algunos enseres que le hacen falta, más adelante le gustaría trasladar su negocio a su casa para eso necesita ampliarlo y mejorarlo.
Germán ¡agradece su apoyo!
texts.en:
The group La Paz in los Olivos is made up of 7 members, most of them residents of the same place. 

One of them is Germán, the group’s treasurer, who worked in the bakery business for a long time but unfortunately he was not doing well so he decided to leave it, which is why he decided to help his wife in her food business installed in the doorway of their house. Little by little he was learning and now has just opened his restaurant in a very central location.

Germán is thankful that he is doing very well. His regular clients enjoy the dishes they prepare in their restaurant. He works there with his wife who is the cook, and he serves the public and manages the business. He will use the loan to improve his business buying cooking utensils and some other tools of the trade that he needs. In the future he would like to move his business to his home but to do this he needs to extend it and improve it.

Germán is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy utensils and tools of the trade

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Yom is aged 53 years. She is married with five children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. For more than 20 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cabbages as primary sources of the family’s income to make a living, and they can earn about 53,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day for their future needs.
 
Yom has been a member of VisionFund for four loan cycles already, and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to make her living conditions better. Now, she is applying for a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to extend her farmland to increase her rice and cabbage farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Kinombe Runyinya Group

texts.en:
Immaculate is a 38-year-old Ugandan citizen, she lives in Rukungiri Municipality – Rukungiri District with her husband and four children. Immaculate is a teacher by profession and teaches in different private schools around Rukungiri district on a part time basis. On top of that she owns a small bar in one of the commercial buildings in Rukungiri.
Immaculate started the business in 2002 with a small amount of capital obtained from her savings while working as a full-time teacher in one of the prominent schools in Rukungiri. She has been able to carry out this business with the help of financial assistance from different financial institutions. She then joined UGAFODE Micro-finance Limited (MDI) under the group lending scheme in Kinombe – Runyinya Group.
With this loan she is intending to improve her bar business and plans to improve sales and increase family income.
Immaculate thanks UGAFODE Micro-finance Limited (MDI) for advancing loans  to the low income earners like her.

loans.use: to buy refreshments to sell at her bar.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine is from Hatsavan village of Syunik region where she lives with her husband, son, and mother-in-law.
Jointly with her family, Heghine runs a farm which includes 3 cows, 4 calves, and 4 lambs. They own agricultural land where they cultivate wheat, barley, and potatoes. Heghine also owns a small orchard where nut, apple, and pear trees are grown with great love and pleasure.
The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest and Heghine's husband and son sell it locally.
Since the farming business helps the family to have income vital for covering daily costs and basic needs, Heghine would like to expand it.
She has requested a loan from SEF International to purchase barley seeds and fertilizer for cultivation. This will enable her to grow more barley and sell it in the local market. 
Heghine and her family work hard to be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 45-year-old conservative woman. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Khadija’s husband works in a media company; he also sells birds at home. On the other hand, Khadija sells her embroidery to make an additional income. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more threads and sewing tools.

loans.use: to buy more threads and sewing tools.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en: Hazem is a 34-year-old governmental employee who is recently married. His wife is a computer engineer working at one of the Jordanian universities. Beside his governmental job he has a private business to bring more income to the family. He opened a party supplies rental shop. Hazem is applying for a loan to carry out some maintenance and cleaning for the chairs he has and to buy new shades.

loans.use: to do some maintenance.

loans.name: Eva Marina

texts.es: Doña Eva de 43 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 23, 19, 17 y 16 años de edad en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 12 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Eva is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children, ages 23, 19, 17, and 16 in a home of their own.  She has a store where she sells primary needs products such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other things.  She’s had the business for 12 years and this has provided her much sales experience that allows her to obtain better earnings.  It’s located in her home and is very well known by the residents in the zone and she has gotten many customers because her store is very well stocked.  She wants to grow her business so she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for the store.  She is certain that she will be able to repay the loan and is confident that she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Fidelina de 49 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hija de 25 años edad. Como toda mujer emprendedora tiene su propio negocio de costura en su lugar de residencia, Tiene 18 años de experiencia en la costura y diseña cualquier tipo de prenda de vestir que los clientes soliciten como faldas, vestidos, pantalones, uniformes, etc. Doña Fidelina solicita un crédito para poder invertir en material para costura como: hilo, tela, elástico, botones, agujas, etc. Que le permitan ofrecer mayor cantidad y variedad de sus estilos de ropa, y asi tener mejores ventas e ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades y vivir en mejores condiciones con su hija.
texts.en: Fidelina  is 49 years old and lives in a home of her own with her 25 years old daughter.  As an entrepreneurial woman, she has her own tailoring business in her home.  She has 18 years’ experience sewing and designs any type of clothing that her customers request, including skirts, dresses, pants, uniforms, etc.  Fidelina is asking for a loan so she can buy sewing supplies such as thread, fabric, elastic, buttons, needles, etc.  This will allow her to offer quantity and a variety of styles of clothing, and in this way have better sales and income so that she can cover her needs and live under better conditions with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ramón es una agricultor que se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mas de veinte años y reside en una comarca llamada El Paraisito a unos 12 km al este del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo, en el departamento de Estelí. El esta felizmente casado y reside en su propia casa de habitación junto a su esposa y uno de sus hijos

Este señor tiene mas de veinte años de trabajar en el ramo de la agricultura donde su principal actividad es la producción de granos básicos tales como es el maíz y frijoles el cual vende a compradores que llegan al sitio en época de verano. Este cliente a diario trabaja en su propiedad ya que en inviernos el produce granos básicos la cual es su principal fuente de ingreso y también se dedica  a la crianza de ganado bovino el que le genera sustento a su familia también

Este cliente es la cuarta vez que se presenta a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el principal objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento  para poder  comprar los principales insumos como son los abonos y fertilizantes y también para preparar el terreno y así poder sembrar los distintos rubros que el cosecha ya que esta próxima la época de inviernos y tiene que estar preparado.

En los financiamiento anteriores este cliente se ha mostrado agradecido ya que le ha ayudado positivamente por que a podido asistir sus cultivo ya que sus ingresos son anuales hasta cuando realiza la venta de los granos el logra a percibir dinero.
texts.en:
Ramon is a farmer who has been doing this for more than 20 years.  He lives in an area called El Paraisito, 12 km east of the town of Pueblo Nuevo, within the Esteli department.  He is happily married and lives in a home of his own along with his wife and children.

This man has more than 20 years working in the farming trade and his main activity is raising basic grains such as corn and beans, which he sells to buyers who arrive in the city during the summer months.  This client works daily on his land and produces basic grains during the winter months, which is his main source of income.  He also raises cattle which also generates sustenance for his family.

This is the fourth time that this client has approached the Ceprodel offices to request a loan so he can buy the supplies he needs, such as compost and fertilizers, and also to prepare the land so he can plant the different crops that he harvests.  The winter is approaching and he needs to be prepared.

He has shown gratitude for the previous loans.  They have positively helped him because he has been able to tend to his crops, since his income is annual and the household needs money until he is able to sell his crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov lives in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 53 years old and widowed with six children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support her family, Pov has been selling lotus roots for ten years. The current business earns her about 80,000 KHR per day to make a living and is able to save 20,000 KHR each day after expenses. Low crop yield has been a challenge for her business. 

Pov has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her support her current business. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Pov will use her portion to buy lotus roots to sell. She hopes to earn more income for her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy lotus roots for resale

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Eang is 56 years old and married. She has eight dependent children, one of whom is still in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava planting. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works as a paid construction worker in the local area. Having been in this business for eighteen years, she can earn about  $13 USD per day and manage to save about $4 USD each day after the expenses. 

Eang is just with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now she is requesting for a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her paddy field and timely grow her rice and cassava in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Bopha, 44, is a widow living with her three children in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling rice and growing cassava and she has been in this business for twenty years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day and is able to save about 15,000 KHR each day after expenses for the future needs.
 
Bopha is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is seeking for a loan to buy more rice to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income in order to make her family's living better.

loans.use: to buy more rice to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of 2 children from Corella, Bohol. She is involved in a charcoal making and selling business for more than 2 years now. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Felipa is asking for a loan to buy more wood for charcoal making. With this, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success. Felipa hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more wood for charcoal making

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace earns a living through her firewood and charcoal business. She is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Corella, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than three years now. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Mary Grace is asking for a loan to buy more firewood and charcoal.  In the future, Mary Grace hopes of making her business a success and sustainable. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman. She is 33 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Analyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase materials and equipment for fishing.

Analyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment for fishing

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina has requested a $600.00 loan to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and slippers. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2005. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy, biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and slippers

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 48 years old, married and has four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 7 years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a 30-year-old married woman from Corella, Bohol and is the mother of two children. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than a year now. 

Glenda wants to expand her business. She joined CEVI to gain access to loans offered by the organization to micro-entrepreneurs like her. She is applying for a loan to buy piglets to raise and feed. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is a married woman and a mother of five children from Corella, Bohol. Renita is involved in a charcoal making business for more than 12 years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Renita is asking for a loan to buy wood for charcoal making. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy wood for charcoal making

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Since 2008, Mr.Usman has been running a chicken shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a 25-year-old hardworking young man. He belongs to a poor family and this shop is the only source of income for his family. He has requested a loan amount of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase chickens from the poultry farm to resell them in the market at profitable price. 

With the help of the profits he wants to put aside some money for his marriage. He hopes that within three or four years he will be able to save a sufficient amount of money to meet the expenses of his marriage. He dreams of the success of his business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en: Aljane is 32 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben has operated a fresh water selling business for the past year, selling from his home to his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season when the business is slow. 

With the 50,000 KES he wants to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for his business. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing another business in the near future. Reuben is appreciative of the previous Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for his business

loans.name: Selvestra

texts.en: Selvestra is a 63-year-old married woman from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She has been involved in a bread making business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. Selvestra is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for bread making like flour, sugar, milk and cooking oil. Selvestra hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for bread making like flour, sugar, milk and cooking oil

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 55 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a food vending business to earn a living. He has been in this business for over 8 years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in 2008, and now he has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase additional food to sell. In the future, he wants to make improvements of his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional food to sell

loans.name: Marta Silvana

texts.es: Marta Silvana de 45 años de edad soltera, con dos hijos que aún están bajo su cargo, ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productiva en el ámbito del comercio, Marta es propietaria del dos negocios que son una pulpería y una panadería, desde muy joven es madre soltera y ha venido luchando, el cual le ha sido muy difícil sacar adelante a su familia, y en ella también ofrece mercadería general productos que son demandados por los consumidores, sus compras son de  contado y vende al contado y crédito. Marta tiene nueve años de experiencia en los negocios que administra y en su meta es expandir sus negocios e ir creciendo cada vez, para preparar profesionalmente a sus hijos,  ella ha optado adquirir un préstamo para invertir más productos en su pulpería como: Arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceites, papel higiénicos, toallas sanitarias, panperes, desodorantes, cremas, champoo, salsas, jabones para ropa y de baño, pastas, carnes variadas, embutidos, variedades de ropas tantos para damas, caballeros y niños, entre otros productos  y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes demandantes.
texts.en: Marta Silvana is 45 years old and single, with two children who are still in her care. She is originally from the department of Chinadega, which is located in the west of the country and is known for being productive in commerce and trade. Marta is the owner of two businesses, a pulpería [small store] and a bakery. She has been a single mother since she was very young and has kept fighting, although it has been very difficult to keep moving her family forward. Marta also offers general merchandise that is in demand with consumers. She makes her purchases in cash and sells for cash or on credit. Marta has nine years of experience running her businesses and her goal is to expand them and to keep growing, in order to prepare her children to be professionals. She has opted to secure a loan to invest in more products for her pulpería, such as rice, sugar, beans, oils, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, diapers, deodorants, creams, shampoo, sauces, laundry and body soap, pastas, various meats, sausages, and a variety of clothing for women, men, and children, among other products. This way, she will be able to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to invest in more products for her store, as she is trying to expand her business

loans.name: Bolivia Mar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLIVIA MAR”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janett es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de artículos varios, tejido de chompas, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, manualidades en goma eva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janett es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo heredo de su abuela y lo continuo desarrollando hasta el momento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es divorciada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y la facilidad del préstamo.

Al grupo acompaña la hija de una de las socias, ella esta vestida con una chaqueta blanca.
texts.en:
The communal bank “BOLIVIA MAR”  is starting its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata central focus. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board of directors of which Janett is president. The businesses of the communal bank's members are varied, among which are: corner shops, selling various items, knitting jumpers, selling food, cosmetics and crafts with Eva foam. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners including Janett. She joined Pro Mujer two years ago when she was invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. At the moment she has a corner shop business which she inherited from her grandmother and has been developing ever since. 

She will use the loan that she will take out on buying rice, sugar and noodles. She will get the products from whole sale vendors in the city of La Paz and then sell them in her store. This work allows her to generate resources to maintain as best as possible her home as she is divorced and has three children.  

When she is asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the healthcare training, the loans and the fact that the loans are easy to access.

In the photo, one of the members is accompanied by her daughter. Janett is dressed with a white jacket.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Yassin

texts.en:
Yassin operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in his business.
 
Here he comes again for another loan of KES 50,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and he appreciates the previous Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosas De Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE CASCADA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa americana, venta de ropa de bebe, costura de overoles, tejido de chompas a mano, fábrica de hormigón, tienda de barrio, pintor, trenzado de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por iniciativa propia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien anteriormente vendía de esta forma, posteriormente decide emprender su propio negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina, azúcar, aceite) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ROSAS DE CASCADA” is starting its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the central focus on Cascada. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Rosmery is president. The businesses that the members take part in vary and include: selling American clothes, selling baby clothes, sewing overalls, knitting jumpers by hand, making cement, a corner shop, a painter and a blanket weaver.  

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners. Rosmery is a member and joined Pro Mujer from her own initiative six months ago. At the moment, she has a corner shop, a trade which she learnt from her mother. After learning from her mother, she decided to start her own shop independently.  
 
The loan that she will take out will pay for flour, sugar and oil which she will buy in bulk at the markets in the city of El Alto and then sell in her shop. This work allows her to generate resources in order to maintain her home as she is single with one child.  

When she is asked what part of Pro Mujer she likes best, she answers that she likes the health part.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline operates a clothes-selling business with the help of the previous Kiva loan, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the previous Kiva loan which helped her greatly.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en:
Mr Shahid is a 38-year-old man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His family consists of two children. Mr Shahid runs a cell phone accessories shop in the main market; it is the only source of income for the family. His shop is very congested and situated in highly-populated area so he is unable to fulfill the demands of customers properly. Therefore he wants to offer more variety in his shop so that he can fulfill the demands of customers more professionally. 

To purchase mobile phone accessories such as casing, data cables, sim cards and chargers for his shop, Mr Shahid has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the profit he is planing to purchase a motorbike for easy conveyance. He dreams of growing his business so that he can provide quality education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a divorced mother of four children, all of whom graduated from school and working. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. Salama dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old, separated and has four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GMDPC in the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires so as to give a better service. In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires so as to give a better service.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 46 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rosma

texts.en:
This is Rosma, age 56, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Raul, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rosma dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a better life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 28 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a personal products business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene la edad  de 51 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de almácigo de una variedad que dé un buen rendimiento, además pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café,  y así hacer  una resiembra a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Francisco is 51 years old. He is married and lives with his children and wife and names them as his biggest priority in life.

With his loan he intends to buy copperwood plants which give a good return and pay a coffee worker so that he can resow at the start of the rainy season. His objective is to increase the density of plants in the area and make the most of the fertile land and good climatic conditions that favour coffee cultivation.

With these improvements, he hopes to obtain some profits and improve his family's living conditions as well as invest a little more in cultivation and in meeting some goals. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had any bank loans before but FUDECOSUR has allowed him easy access to the loan and the interest rates are very low.

loans.use: to aid coffee cultivation

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a cosmetic selling business, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a food stall business, selling from home which earns her another source of livelihood. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Mwanakombo dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 80,000, she wants to purchase stock of cosmetics and food stuffs for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics and food stuffs to re-sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 21 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and he is not married. He has a bakery, electronics and a boda boda (bicycle taxi) business. He has been in the bakery business for the past two years.
He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy stock of wheat flour, sugar and eggs for the bakery. He hopes to buy a car for distributing his cakes in the near future.

loans.use: To buy stock of wheat flour, sugar and eggs for his bakery

loans.name: Yem's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Yem is now 37 years old and married. She has one daughter who is still in school. Yem and her husband are farmers who grow rice as their main business to support the family and they supplement the family’s income by raising pigs. Having been in the business for seventeen years, they are able to make a daily income of 35,000 KHR and manage to save about 17,000 KHR each day.
This is the first loan for Yem with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying pig feeds. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her rice plantation and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Yousaf

texts.en:
Mr. Yousaf is a 32-year old man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He has been selling embroidered clothes in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He is a father of two children.

He is interested in purchasing a variety of different colored threads and machinery parts for the embroidery machine in his shop. For that reason he has requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes that one day he will able to increase his capital so that he can start a small embroidery firm in his town.

He wants to save a good amount for the better future of his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase thread and machinery parts for embroidery.

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Nen is a 29-year-old mother of two dependent children; one is in school while the other one is still too young for school. She is a rice farmer in the local area. She does this to support her family. Having been in this business for nine years, she is able to earn about 37,000 KHR per day and she can manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
This is the first loan for Nen with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice timely and successfully so as to have a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Sarantuya, 50 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her husband has been making building masonry, plumbing and welding. She herself has been working as a chief cook at a military base for eleven years. The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, cements, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, her husband can repair and insulate the house, making their home a more comfortable and warmer place. More importantly, the renovated higher quality house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less coal, and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es: Carlos Emilio, tiene la edad  de 69 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo  que den un buen rendimiento en esta zona y así hacer  una resiembra a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos Emilio is 69 years old. He is married and lives with his wife; she is his number one priority. 

With this loan, he hopes to buy fertilisers and fungicides and to pay for labour for assistance work tending the coffee. He also wants to buy some plants for shade, which leads to good production in this area. He plans to sow again at the start of the rains in order to increase the density of plants on his land, as well as to take advantage of factors, such as the very fertile land and the climatic conditions, etc. which favour coffee production. 
He hopes that with these improvements to his crops his earnings will increase a bit and thereby improve his family’s quality of life. He could also invest more money in the land he works and achieve some goals.  

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not received any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted the loan with better facilities and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to tend to his coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make curios to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 16000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle.

Evangeline has been in this business for 23 years now.

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle.

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a pig raising business. She sells the pigs to earn a living. She has been in this business for over 5 years and earns 4,000PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2009. Now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase feed for the pigs. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pig raising.

loans.name: Vern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Preshnet Preah district of Banteay Meanchey province, Vern is a 32-year-old mother of two dependent children, who are still in school. She has been growing cassava and selling grocery items for ten years. She can earn a daily income of approximately KHR 71,000 and is able to save about KHR 18,000 each day for future needs.
This is the third loan for Vern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve their financial burdens. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow her cassava healthfully and fruitfully so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Nichodemus

texts.en:
Nichodemus is married, and has two children who attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children.
For the past six years, he has operated a rental house leasing business. His major challenge is seasonality.
With the KES 20,000 he wants to refurbish the rental house by painting it. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to refurbish his rental house by painting it.

loans.name: Roern

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Roern is 39 years old and married. She has two dependent children, one of whom is in school. She works as a farmer who grows rice, cassava and rubber in the local area. Having been in this business for 13 years, she is able to earn about 69,000 KHR per day to support her family.
This is Roern’s first cycle with VisionFund and now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes to get a high crop yield so as to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and single.
Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising hogs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.
Evangeline has been raising hogs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to sustain it.
Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Ky is 43 years old and is a widowed mother of four children. She makes a living through planting cassava, growing cassava and rubber tree, which she has been doing for 23 years. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day and she is able to save about 28,000 KHR daily for the future needs.
This is the first loan for Ky with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and use a portion of it to spend on laborers to plow the field. She hopes to make more crops to sell for a good price to make her family’s living standards better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and to pay for plowing costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lynneth

texts.en:
Lynneth is 31 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has seven school-going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

Grace has operated a clothes-selling business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Thoeun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Thoeun, 41, is married and has three children. She and her husband grow rice and plant cassava as the main business for the family’s income. Having been in the business for 20 years, they can earn about 18,000 KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs and manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day.
 
Thoeun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her better support her current business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.
