As the leader, she is going to use her portion to plow the field for growing cassava. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her cassava timely and healthfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To plow the field for growing cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang, 26, is married and has two children residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. One of her children is in school. 

To support the family, she has been farming rice and cassava for seven years while her husband works as a paid worker in local area. Together, they can earn about KHR 17,000 per day and can save about KHR 6,000 each day for future needs.
  
Heang’s group consists of two members who are female and they both are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. Heang hopes to grow more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en:
Sokna is age 50 years and married with one dependent child. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, earning a living through working as a paid worker in a rubber field. She and her husband can earn about KHR 18,000 per day and can save about KHR 8,000 each day for future needs.

This is Sokna’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and both have been members of VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy household supplies for her family such as bed, table, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her to have enough household supplies for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy household supplies for her family such as bed, table, etc.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hoert's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Hoert is aged 38 years and married with three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee to better support her family. Having been in this business for 12 years, Hoert manages to earn about 35,000 KHR per day and can save about 22,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Hoert has been with VisionFund for four cycles, and has completely paid back these loans, while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her rice paddy so as to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Sara Yaneth

texts.es: Sara de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su madre y hermanos, ella posee una tienda desde hace 3 años donde vende productos de primera necesidad como frijol, maíz, embutidos, panes, bebidas , golosinas, entre otros, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia por los años que tiene de ternerla se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite alcanzar muy buenas ganancias, tiene mucha clientela pues la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Sara quiere realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, embutidos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sara is 43 years old and lives with her mother and siblings.  She has had a store for three years, where she sells primary needs products such as beans, corn, sausages, bread, drinks, snacks, and other things.  Her business is located in her home and over the years she has gotten much sales experience, which has allowed here to have very good earnings.  She has many customers who prefer her because everything she sells is of good quality and her prices are good.  Above all she provides excellent service.

Sara wants to make a new investment but doesn’t have enough capital, so she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy basic grains, bread, sausages, instant products, drinks, etc.  She is very responsible and is certain that she will come out of debt and she is also certain that she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a father of three children.

He owns a sweater shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This shop is the only source of income for the family, so he is interested in purchasing a variety of wool for knitting sweaters. Though summer season is started in the area, he wants to increase the stock of his business for the next season by knitting as many sweaters as he can. This will help him to increase his net income and savings in the winter season and will save his time as well. 
 
However, due to the lack of capital, he finds it difficult to purchase the needed things. Therefore has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He dreams for the growth of his business and for the bright future of his children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of wool for knitting sweaters.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gemma has been in this business for 20 years now.

Gemma requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase materials like fishing net, rope and other materials for fishing.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fishing net, rope and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with five children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kanze wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vendor in the area to raise good profits and improve her standard of living.

For that reason with the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 30 years old, married, and a father of one. His wife is a teacher who earns additional income. He learned about KADET LTD from a marketing campaign that was carried out in his area of work. 

He has run a retail shop for the past three years earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000. With a first loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD, he plans to restock his shop with a variety of consumable products.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back to business for expansion. His future dreams is to be successful in life

loans.use: to restock his retail shop with a variety of consumable products.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
Sitha, 40, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For the last 11 years Sitha has been a teacher while her husband is a farmer to support the family. Together, they can earn about 91,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Sitha’s group consists of two members. They both are a seven-cycle clients with VisionFund. The past loans, which Sitha successfully repaid, have helped her support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sitha wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to timely grow her rice so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto, tiene la edad  de 25 años, está en unión libre, vive con su hijo y esposa, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera, pintura, zinc  y otros materiales, además de pagar mano de obra en la reparación a la vivienda, y de esta manera  protegen un poco más las estructuras de la humedad, principalmente la madera que no tenga entradas de agua a la vivienda en el periodo de lluvia que ya casi inicia y así tener una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su familia tenga un bienestar mejor y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 25 years old. He lives in a partnership with his son and wife and they are his highest priority.

He intends to use his loan to buy wood, paint, zinc and other supplies, and in addition pay the laborers repairing his home, and in this way the structures will be protected a bit more from humidity. Mainly, so the wood will not let the water enter during the rainy season that’s almost here and thus give his family a better quality of life.

With this investment he intends to make improvements to his home so his family can have better wellbeing and take advantage of the low prices of some good quality materials. This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He has not had previous loans in state banks, but Fudecosur has made the process easier and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to improve his housing with the purchase of wood, paint, zinc and other supplies and to pay the laborers

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito is 53 years old, married, and has five children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

He plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been in his business for over eight years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in the year 2004, and now he has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Sreymach's Group

texts.en:
Sreymach, 31,  is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is a mother of two children who are dependent and still in school. 

She earns a living through selling vegetables in her village while her husband works as a garment worker to complement the income for her family. Sreymach and her husband earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Sreymach with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of five to apply for a loan with VisionFund of 160,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a latrine, such as a toilet bowl, tile, drainage, etc. Sreymach hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a latrine, such as a toilet bowl, tile, drainage, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete electrical rewiring in her home

loans.name: Amanecer De Huayhuasi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER HUAYHUASI”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Leonora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de tejidos, chapista, chofer, producción de aretes, tienda de barrio, venta de repuestos, producción de guantes, producción de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Leonora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías (elaboración de guantes); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de sus padres que realizan este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en a una empresa que exporta este producto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y cuida a sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank Amanecer Huayhuasi will begin their 2nd cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. It is made up of 10 members and they are headed by a board where Leonora is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied and among them are: making and selling textiles, metal plater, driver, making earrings, grocery store, selling spare parts, making gloves, and growing potatoes.

The loan will benefit the microenterprises where Leonora is a member. She says that this is her first time with Pro Mujer, and she joined through the invitation from a promoter from the institution who visited her home. Currently she has a crafts business (making gloves); she discloses that she learned the business from her parents who are in this line of work.

The loan that she is getting is to increase her capital (to buy wool) that she will acquire from the markets in the city of El Alto and later she will make and sell her creations to a business that exports this product. This line of work allows her to generate resources to maintain the household as she is single and takes care of her parents.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that the likes the training.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry, tiene la edad  de35 años, está en unión libre, vive con su hijo y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  unas terneras pequeñas  que tengan buenas características para que ha futuro sean unas vacas buenas para la producción de leche. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez ir mejorando el hato de ganado y desarrollar terneras que en el futuro vacas con un buen rendimiento. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Henry, 35 years old, is in a common-law marriage and lives with his son and wife, who are his main priority.  With his loan he is trying to purchase some small calves that are well-suited to being good dairy cows in the future.  The idea is to take advantage of the grassy space he has, as well as the good terrain and climate conditions so that he is able have these animals and at the same time improve the herd of cattle and develop the calves to become cows with good performance in the future.  

With this purchase he could develop another business activity and at the same time have savings that will allow him to have more animals and invest more in the property.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to the exterior of his home

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is 65 years old and was married but is a widower with four children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a banana production business to earn a living. He has been in his business for over four years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in the year 2004, and now he has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, he wants to make improvements on his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fetilizer such as manure

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Phan is aged 31 and married. She has two children. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for ten years, and her husband works as a paid construction worker to better support the family. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day.
 
Phan has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her current business. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy a hand tractor to support her paddy business. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor to support her paddy business

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en: Pascalia is a married woman. She has 2 children,, aged 2 years and 4 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a clothing store, and she has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. Her business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy land and build her own house. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to sell

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Ratha is 24 years old and lives in a rural area located in the Kandal Steong district of Kandal province. He has been farming rice and growing vegetables for five years. He is able to earn about US $4 per day from his current business. He sometimes works as a paid construction worker in the local area to earn additional income for the family.

This is the first microloan for Ratha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He will also use a portion of the loan to renovate his old house. He hopes this loan will enable him to get a high yield from his rice paddy field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland and to renovate his home

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a widow and the mother of seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

Sidi has operated a coconut vending business for the past three years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Sidi dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 27-year-old lady, married and supporting a family of four members. The children are ages 10, 6, 4 and 2 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he assists in catering for the family's basic needs.

Gladys learnt about KADET Ltd. from other women in the market who are already being funded by KADET Ltd. She has successfully paid off her previous loan from her cereals sales business. She has been advanced a second loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings which will facilitate putting up a stall for her business.

Gladys will use the business proceeds to cover the children's school fees. Her hope is to enlarge her business as well as buy a posho mill to grind the cereals for added value and more profits.

loans.use: to put up a stall

loans.name: Tsengelmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Tsengelmaa, 48 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in their own house on a plot of land. She has been teaching kindergarten since 2002 and, during her free time, she also washes clothes and linens. Her husband has been rendering transportation services to local people, using his own truck. Their children all live on their own and sometimes gives them cash or foodstuffs to help them. The house they live in was built last year, but the walls and roof of house are vulnerable to strong winds and storms and, in the harsh wintertime, the family chills to their cores. So she is applying for a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials, such as cement, paint, fiberglass, foam and cotton. Using those materials, she and her husband will insulate their house, and this will make their home a more comfortable, warmer, place. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and thus contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is very hard-working individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass, foams and cottons so that she and her husband can insulate their house, keep warm in the winter, and burn less coal.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single mother of three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food café business, selling from home to passersby and neighbours. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking fat, potatoes, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking fat, potatoes, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a food vendor from the town of Tagbilaran, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven children. Bebiana is engaged in selling snack foods like peanuts and others. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a farmer.

Bebiana is asking for a loan to buy more peanuts to sell. She hopes that she will be able to improve her income and savings. Bebiana also dreams of exploring another ventures to enhance her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts to sell

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Sarat is aged 34 and lives with her family members in a rural village located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband farm rice on three hectares of farmland and work as paid worker in the local area to feed the family. The current businesses earns her about 24,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for  future needs. 

Saret’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She is in her first microloan with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a living better

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a copra (dried coconut) production business to earn a living. She has been in this business for over 8 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. Nena joined GDMPC in 2010. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase copra materials. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for producing copra (dried coconut)

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a 30-year-old single gentleman who takes care of his niece, age 13 years old. He is a livestock trader in Bomet county in Kenya, and has been running the business for the past three years making a monthly income of 27,000 KES.

He learned about KADET LTD from other livestock traders who are registered and are funded by KADET LTD. Jonah has borrowed his second loan of 30,000 KES from KADET  LTD which he intends to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase animals for trade

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 44 years old. She lives in alone in Rustavi District. Maka is a professional sewer. She has a sewing machine and is working from her house to earn a small monthly income. This is the only source of living for her and she is working as hard as she can to cover her monthly expenses.

Maka requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and her poor living conditions. 
 
Maka requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Maka has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Maka will purchase additional materials and equipment for sewing. She wants to expand her business. Purchasing more materials and equipment will give Maka an opportunity to work faster and serve more clients. This will significantly increase her income and she will be able to improve her living conditions and cover the monthly expenses.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and equipment for sewing

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with five children, all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Halima wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vendor in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason with the Kshs 20,000 she wants  to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, and watermelons. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, and watermelons

loans.name: Tarpuy Group

texts.es: El grupo “TARPUY” está conformado por 14 socios trabajadores dedicadas al comercio minorista. Eva es una de las socias del grupo tiene 50 años con 3 hijos. Trabaja con representante de productos de belleza AVON hace 15 años. Eva  se siente bien en la actividad que realiza porque ella misma hace sus horarios de trabajo  y puede darse tiempo para las labores de su hogar y a su nieta que vive con ella. El préstamo lo utilizara en la matricula y las pensiones universitarias de sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Eva es la persona que viste champa negra y de la misma manera está incluida la foto del  señor Celestino en la parte superior izquierda porque no pudo estar presente en la foto grupal por motivos de laborales.
texts.en:
The group “Tarpuy” consists of 14 members working as commercial retailers. 

Eva is one of the members of the group. She is 50 years old with 3 children. She has been working as an Avon beauty products representative for 15 years. Eva is happy with her work because she makes her own work schedule and has time to do household chores and be with her granddaughter who lives with her.

The loan will be used for tuition and college housing fees for her children. Her greatest desire is to see her children become professionals.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan. Eva is the person wearing the black sweater, and the photo includes Celestino in the top left since he could not be present for the group photo because of work reasons.

loans.use: to pay college tuition and dorm fees for her children

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en:
Ya, a rural villager living in Kampong Cham Province’s Ou Reang Ov District, is age 51 and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a rice farmer who has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland for 30 years to make a living. She supplements this income by working for others for a fee. Ya can earn about 21,000 riels (KHR) per day from the current business and manages to save 10,000 KHR daily for future needs.

Ya is in her first cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. Ya is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice in time, so as to better her living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Shamsulzaman

texts.en: Mr. Shamsulzaman is 56 years old. He lives in the area of Lahore, in Pakistan. He has been running a general store in the market near his house, which is the only source of income for the family. He is the father of three daughters and three sons. He has too few products in his shop and, because of that, most of the time he has to refuse his customers the products they require. He has applied for a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy washing powder, soap and detergents to sell. He is hopeful that the loan will help him to offer more variety in the store and greatly help him to fulfill the demands of his customers. This will gradually help him to increase his monthly net income. He will use the profits to meet the occasional expenses of his family. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy washing powder, soap and detergents for his store, so he can offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is 34 years old, married, and blessed with five children aged between 4 and 20. He has been running a retail shop for the past four years, achieving a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, of KES 20,000, and he plans to restock his shop with a variety of consumable products. The expected profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. His dream for the future is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock his kiosk with a variety of consumable goods.

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en: Som, 64, lives in a rural village in the Kandal Province’s Kandal Stoeng district. She is a widow and a mother. Her family’s income is from leasing a rice paddy. She has been in this business for 10 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 28,000 per day, and she manages to save about KHR 4,000 per day for future needs. Som’s group is composed of six members who are joining Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Som is going to use her portion to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with seven children. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Mwanakombo has operated an open-air food stall; her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality of products in the market.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Evella

texts.en: Evella is a fish vendor from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the fish vending business for more than 27 years. Evella works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell so that she will be able to improve her business and increase her income. Evella dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 36-year-old Lebanese who lives with his wife. Like every couple, Mohammad and his wife wish to offer their coming child a respectable life, far from problems and difficulties. For this reason, they combine forces to afford their heavy living expenses. Mohammad opened his own butchery many years ago. He’s a reputable person who always seeks to deliver his customers good and fresh products. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy cattle for his business. With the loan, he hopes to develop his business and augment his sales. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and start his own dairy products trading business as a parallel job.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle for his business

loans.name: Uuganbyamba

texts.en:
Mr. Uuganbyamba, 28 years old, lives with his wife and 3-year-old child in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a rental apartment. He, together with his wife, has been running a barbershop since 2011. The mother-in-law currently looks after his 3-year-old child. His wife has specialized in designer profession. Before opening their barbershop, they had been selling products such as shampoo, conditioner and hair dye. 

Mr. Uuganbyamba is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase necessary equipment such as chairs, poles, towel warmers and sanitizers for opening a new barbershop. Recently, he has rented a place near a trade center and wants to open a branch of his barbershop there. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase barbershop equipment

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman, age 37 years. She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a suburban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. Grace will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. Her business goal is to sell clothes in wholesale within 5 years. She also does farming to supplement her income. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sinfrosa

texts.en:
Sinfrosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a hog raising business in the Philippines. Sinfrosa has been in this business for 14 years now and earns additional income from a general store.

Sinfrosa requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vaccines for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her hog-raising business. Sinfrosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Ibonne

texts.en:
Ibonne is a dried fish vendor from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Ibonne is a married woman and has been engaged in dried fish selling for more than four years now. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Ibonne is asking for a loan to buy new fishing materials like fishing nets and lead weights. Through this, her husband will be able to catch more, thus giving them more fish to dry and sell in the market. Ibonne has hopes of expanding her business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new fishing materials like fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 43 years old, married, and a mother of five children. For the last twelve years, she has earned a living by selling fish in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 


Kadzo was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan of KES. 30,000 to buy additional fish for her business to sell to her customers, as well as putting up a permanent structure for her business.


She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue with her business with a possibility of owning a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish and build a permanent kiosk

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a widow and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishability of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jardines De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDINES DE SENKATA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de gorras, venta de carne, taller de costura, tienda de barrio, venta de electrodomésticos, comercio de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por la necesidad económica que tiene ya que es rentable.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank “Jardines de Senkata” will begin its 2nd cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. It is made up of 6 members and is headed by a board where Lidia is the Treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank engage in are varied and among them are: selling hats, selling meat, tailoring, neighborhood store, selling appliances, and selling clothing.

The loan they are making will benefit the microenterprises where Lidia is a member. She says that she has been with Pro Mujer for 5 months, joining through the invitation of her sister who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling cosmetics, disclosing that she began the business because of financial need and that it is profitable.

The loan that she is taking now is to increase her capital, to buy cosmetics that she will buy from the distributors in the city of La Paz, and later she will sell them from her home. This line of work allows her to generate income to maintain the household as much as possible as she lives in a partnership and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says that she likes the training covering health and credit.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Franci Noemi

texts.es:
Franci es una joven de 21 años de edad madre soltera con mucha fuerza, energía y con muchas metas y sueños dedicada a los oficios domésticos y a la caficultura. Su padre quien desde toda una vida se ha dedicado al cultivo y siembra de café le heredo una propiedad la cual está ubicada a 12 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada en vehículo diariamente. De esta forma ella ha podido trabajar y generar sus ingresos para poder sostenerse y cubrir sus necesidades y las de su hijo. Ella vive con sus padres los cuales le ha enseñado a ser una persona honrada y muy trabajadora ya que para ella los principios inculcados por sus padres son muy importantes para superarse en la vida. Franci tiene un grado de educación primaria completo y no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de recursos económicos. 

Hoy en día solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, bombas de fumigación lo cual le ayudara a mantener su cultivo sano y libre de cualquier plaga o enfermedad que pueda destruir su cultivo como la roya.

Su meta es lograr sacar una buena cosecha la cual le permita generar ingresos para poder cumplir con su sueño que es de crear una micro-empresa la cual tiene como finalidad la compra venta de café para venderlo de forma molida para consumo mismo que saldrá de sus cultivos. Sus sueños son formar un capital para apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios y que él pueda graduarse a nivel universitario y logre sus metas y sueños como hasta ahora lo hace ella.
texts.en:
Franci is a 21 year old single mother who has a lot of strength, energy, and many goals and dreams.  She works taking care of her household and growing coffee.  Her father, who planted and harvested coffee all of his life, gave her a property which is located about 12 kilometers from her home.  She travels there in a car every day.  This has allowed her to work and generate income to support herself and pay for the necessities for herself and her son.  She lives with her parents, who taught her to be an honorable and hardworking person since for them the values their parents taught them were important in succeeding in life.  Franci finished primary school, but could not finish studying due to a lack of financial resources.

Currently she is requesting help to purchase fertilizer, manure, and fumigation bombs, which will help her keep her crops healthy and free of any plagues or diseases that could destroy them, such as rust.

Her goal is to have a good harvest which will allow her to generate income so that she can achieve her dream, which is to start a small business which sells ground coffee, so that they can consume the same coffee that comes from their crops.  Her dreams are to save money to support her son in his studies so that he can graduate from university and achieve his goals and dreams like she is.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, and fumigation bombs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rafique

texts.en:
Rafique is a hardworking tailor by profession. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with his family. He is 41 years old and the father of 5 children. He desires to set aside enough savings to pay for the higher education and marriage expenses of his children. 

Rafique has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses. He is hopeful that by purchasing one more machine he will be able to fulfill his customers' demands more professionally and increase his net income and savings. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 25-year-old single woman who has been working in the beauty business for six years. Manal likes her business a lot and puts as much effort in developing it as she can to make sure that her customers are pleased. 

Manal is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to make new decoration and do some maintenance to her salon, to attract new customers and to please current ones.

Manal has a very good reputation in her area. She is well known because of her long experience in this field and in her region. Almost all of her customers are relatives, friends and neighbors who support and trust her a lot.

Manal will work hard to keep on developing her business, to expand it and add new services that will please her customers.

loans.use: To make new decoration and do some maintenance to her salon

loans.name: Skender

texts.en:
Skender is 40 years old. He is married and raising three children. His wife spends most of her time taking care of the children and their home. For more than 10 years, Skender has been providing woodcutting services for heating in his community. Through his work, he helps his family and gives them everything they need. Now Skender is in need of a loan in order to buy some new tools for his tractor to transport the wood in his area. They are very happy to have the possibility of getting a loan as they have the chance to improve their living conditions and have healthy food.

Skender wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy new tools for his tractor to transport wood

loans.name: Muharrem

texts.en:
Muharrem is a 37-year-old father of two young children, 10 and 8 years old, who lives with his family in the very rural, southern part of Kosovo. He is the only financial provider for the family. He is busy every day, all day long. 

Muharrem has worked in construction for a long time, but with a very low salary. He also keeps livestock including animals like cows and goats.  In order to generate more income he is planning to start up his own business selling milk and milk product to dairy farms in his region.

The loan of 500 Euro that Muharrem is requesting from KosInvest is to buy a cow and a calf. His goal is to expand his business, and this will happen soon, Muharrem says. He is very gratefully for this opportunity!

loans.use: To buy a cow and a calf

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana, 44, is married. She is a mother of two children, 18 and 16 years old. They all live in a minority community. 

Suzana works as a nurse and her husband works in a restaurant. Currently they live in a house which is in need of some renovation of walls. Suzana is requesting a loan to buy materials for building a wall in her yard.

This loan will help improve their living conditions and achieve her goals. She hopes to save the money to ensure financial security for future children. In the near future she is hoping to have a better life. Suzana is very happy about this opportunity. Knowing that is a Kiva loan, she thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy materials for building a wall in her yard

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria, habita en el municipio de Masaya, junto a su esposo e hijos, ella es comerciante desde hace mas de 10 años, su mayor sueño es mejorar de condiciones de vida, su esposa le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ya que trabaja por cuenta propia, ella vende Frutas y verduras en el mercado del Municipio, su forma de trabajo es la siguiente, comprara los frutos en cosecha que todavia se encuentran el el arbol y luego lo comercializa, con este credito compra varias frutas como, Aguacate, Tamarindo, Limones etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Ana Maria lives in the town of Masaya together with her husband and children.  She has been a merchant for more than ten years.  Her biggest dream is to improve her family's quality of life.  Her husband helps with the household expenses since he self-employed.  Ana Maria sells fruits and vegetables in the town market.  She purchases fruit harvests that are still on the tree and later sells them.  She will use this loan to purchase various fruits such as avocados, tamarinds, and lemons.  She is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva loans have provided.

loans.use: to purchase fruit crops.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more cosmetic and hairdressing tools to satisfy her customers. 
Diep's previous loans enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to further increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. Diep also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and hairdressing tools to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Wafae

texts.en:
Wafae is a married youth client from Iraq who is 26 years old and has three children. She assists her husband to together provide the family income.
Wafae is a tailor and works from home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child, but in 2004 took tailoring to a new level and started sewing clothes for a living. She has good experience in this field.
Wafae is requesting a youth loan of 2,100 USD. She will use this loan to renovate her workplace and to buy a new sewing machine. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. In doing so, she will be able to educate her children and assist her husband in providing for their family’s needs in order to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to renovate her workplace and to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown-up children from Dagohoy, Bohol. Marilyn runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Marilyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to sell more and increase her sales and income. In the future, Marilyn has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbold, 51 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been driving a firetruck for eight consecutive years. His wife has been selling nails to local people for ten years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in nail sales.

Last year, he and his wife built their own house on their land but the house is losing its heat through the door. So he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, metal and cement. Using these materials, he can build a barn which will be attached to the house door and  will reduce heat loss through the door. If the house stops losing its heat, the family won't burn as much coal and will contribute to the efforts against air pollution by releasing less smoke. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as planks, metal and cement

loans.name: Bonne Semence 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Slim, age 43, is married with a 13-year-old son. His son is currently attending school. He is representing the Bonne Semence 2 (1) group. Slim has an electronics shop where he sells a variety of items. He has had this business for over 10 years and has gained a good understanding of electronics in this time. He will use the loan to buy cell phones, USB drives, and cameras to sell in his shop. His business strategy is to not only sell individual items, but to sell in bulk to some customers as well. 

Slim has received five previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE  Congo. He has a good repayment record. In the future, he would like to work in micro-finance and partner with HOPE. He sees what a difference these loans make in his community. He hopes his son will work in communications or electronics one day as well.

loans.use: to pay for electronic devices, including cell phones, USB drives, and cameras.

loans.name: Mt Magoroto Group

texts.en:
Husna, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children who are in school. Since 2008, Husna has been running a cafe selling water, soft drinks and chips. She works from 5am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be her 7th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she repaid successfully, she replaced stock for her cafe. With the profit received, she covered home expenses and school fees. She will use this loan to increase her cafe stock. She dreams to own a mini-supermarket. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mt Magoroto, which has a total of 9 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  increase cafe stock.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and married with five children. With one child currently in school, Yolanda works very hard to provide for them. Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines. Yolanda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, bread, soft drinks and other groceries. 

Yolanda requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, noodles, bread, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mere

texts.en: Mere is a 59-year-old single woman with 1 child. She makes and sells pancakes and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Mere needs a loan to purchase sacks of sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, forks and boxes of chicken legs to help her in operating her business. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her children's education. Mere has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, forks, boxes of chicken legs, etc.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas, who is from Iraq, is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. Abbas and one of his children provide the income of the family together.
Abbas owns a shop where he sells tools and supplies. He has broad experience in this field. Since his youth, Abbas and his friend worked together in a similar shop until 2000, when he established his own business. Now Abbas has an employee and has grown in fame and respect in his surrounding area.
Abbas is requesting a loan of 2,700 USD to install a rolling shutter and signage for his shop. He aims to grow his business more so that he may be able to take better care of his family with the profits that he gains.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and signage for his shop

loans.name: Dieu Pourvoira 2 Group

texts.en:
Chalvigny, age 25, is single with no children. He is representing the Dieu Pourvoira 2 group. Chalvigny owns a food stall where he sells a variety of grocery items. He has had this business since 2008, around 5 years! 

He will use the loan to buy various food products, including cans of sardines and rice. His business strategy is to be friendly and helpful to all of his customers. He believes good customer service is what brings clients back to his shop.
 
This is Chalvigny's first loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. HOPE and Chalvigny's group are confident in his ability to repay the loan. He hopes to continue his business far into the future.

loans.use: to pay for various food products, including cans of sardines and rice.

loans.name: Bonne Semence 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Valerie, age 53, is married with 6 children, ages 26 to 38 years old. She is representing the Bonne Semence 2 (2) group. She sells used clothing in a local market. She has had this business for 13 years! She has gained valuable customers over the years. 

Valerie will use the loan to buy larges bales of used clothing from her supplier. In Congo, used clothing is sold to local vendors in large bales and then separated out to be sold individually. Her business strategy is to offer friendly customer service to her clients.
 
She has received 5 previous loans from HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She wants her business to continue to succeed and make a large enough profit to enable her to travel abroad. She hopes her children will continue to work and be successful adults.

loans.use: to pay for bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a married man aged 35 years. He lives in Lwabbanda with his wife and their children who attend different schools in the Rakai district.
He is a business man who deals in retail and whole sale in the Ddwaniro trading center. Willy is also a farmer and a primary school teacher.
He has been trading since 2010 and he started this business in order to earn a better living.

He has acquired a 2,000,000 UGX loan in order to add to his business. He sells his products to residents of Ddwaniro and other traders from different trading centers nearby.
He hopes to enlarge his business so that he can supply his customers on a  larger scale. He faces the problem of delayed payments by his customers since the majority of them take goods on credit.
He describes himself as a hard working man. His advice to  lenders is to always monitor their clients in order to give guidance where necessary.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Agim

texts.en:
Agim wants to thank Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which helped him to repair his vehicle, to change the tires for wintertime and to buy engine oil. The previous loan has helped to increase his business profit and to improve the family's living conditions. He is very satisfied and happy with his business income. He plans to continue his taxi business in the future. 

Now Agim is requesting a second loan for a different purpose. Now he is in need of a loan to buy a milk cow. The loan will help him and his family to cut the daily expenses for milk, cheese and other milk products. Agim's goal is to provide a secure life for his family. He thanks Kiva lenders again for their support on his second loan!

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is 57 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he owns and operates a business in the local community of raising pigs to sell. He has been in his business for over 5 years and earns about 10,000PHP every month. He has joined GDMPC to purchase feeds for his pigs. In the future, he wants to make improvements on his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for pigs.

loans.name: Dieu Pourvoira 3 Group

texts.en:
Leontine, age 31, is married with a 14-year-old daughter who is currently attending school. Leontine is part of the Dieu Pourvoira 3 group. She sells used clothing in a local market. She has had this business for over 10 years! She has gained a valuable reputation in the market over the years. 

Leontine will use the loan to buy large bales of used clothing from her supplier. In Congo, used clothing is sold to local vendors in large bales and then separated out to be sold individually. Her business strategy is to offer her customers a personal service of picking out clothes she knows they want. She sets them aside and sells them to the specific person. 

This is Leontine's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and her group are confident she will repay the loan. She would like to create another activity in the future. She hopes her daughter will continue her studies and attend a university one day.

loans.use: to pay for bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Kintouadi 1 Group

texts.en:
Armand, age 32, is married with a 4-month-old daughter. He is representing the Kintouadi 1 Group.

Armand is a very industrious and talented man. His main business is to sell drinks and plastic chairs. He has had this business for four years. He is also a professional photographer and is hired to take pictures at weddings and other large events. He has done small photography jobs since 2003. He will use this loan to pay for more chairs and drinks to sell. His business strategy is to play music and provide chairs for customers to hang out and have a drink at his shop.

Armand has received one previous loan from Kiva's partner HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to continue to succeed in his business and continue into the future.

loans.use: to pay for plastic chairs and cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Karin Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  8   mujeres  emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “KARIN”.  La Sra. Bertha   de 46 años de edad casada  y madre de  3 hijos, la Sra. Bertha tiene una pequeña bodega  ya hace unos  15  años. La Sra. Bertha ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su bodega  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Bertha   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Bertha es  la segunda de la mano izquierda esta parada polo azul,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The communal group “KARIN” is comprised of 8 entrepreneurial women with great creativity for business. Bertha is 46 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She has a small grocery store which she has had for about 15 years. She has been able to promote to her customers which has generated profits for her which has allowed her to cover the household expenses. In the future she would like to have her own premises where she can sell her products and obtain greater economic gains. 

With the loan given she will invest it to buy more products for her grocery store and thus continue satisfying her customers' needs and to be able to come out ahead. At the same time, Bertha and all the members are very grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the assurance that has been given to them.
 
Bertha is the second on the left; she is wearing a blue shirt. Saying goodbye, she promises that she will fulfill her goals proposed.

loans.use: to buy more products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 25 years old. He lives in Kutaisi district with his father, his two children (4 and 6 years old), his 22-year-old brother and their retired grandmother. Nugzar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family has a shoe business with a workshop in their house. Nugzar and his brother make shoes and sell them to the villagers and at the local markets. His father is a truck driver and earns a small monthly salary. Additional family income is from his grandmother’s monthly pension. 

Nugzar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Nugzar will install gas equipment in his car. He wants to trade with bread. He will buy bread at the wholesale price from bakeries and distribute it to local shops with a price markup. As gas is a much cheaper fuel, Nugzar will have less expense, which will increase his profit. This will give him an opportunity to earn additional income for the family and provide better living conditions for them.

loans.use: To install gas equipment in his own car.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Myrna works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family – especially for the schooling of their children.

Myrna is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, she will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. In the future, Myrna hopes to make their business successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
Perfil Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción 
Fray Casiano Puntarenas
Mayo 2013

	Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción está formado por  6 integrantes quienes han trabajado en años anteriores tanto con Fundación Mujer como en otros grupos de la zona de Puntarenas, demostrando organización, solidaridad, trabajo en grupo, además de mantener un ahorro y una organización consolidada. 

Las solicitantes del préstamo grupal  tienen 5 años de trabajar  en la zona. Con el Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción se mantiene  la Junta Directiva y se levantó el acta  de solicitud  del tercer préstamo de  este grupo.

	Ellas presentan actividades diversas y consolidadas permitiendo tener una base importante para garantizar este préstamo. Las integrantes tienen claro cómo llevar la generación de ingresos de cada una, tienen los conceptos de trabajo en grupo, garantía solidaria y ahorro.  Su trabajo y esfuerzo está validado con el apoyo de instituciones como el Instituto Mixto de Ayuda Social y Fundación Mujer, quien les ha permitido tener actividades consolidadas (pulpería, bazar y café Internet),  contando con equipo, local y mobiliario para su microempresa. 

Doña Flora tiene un café internet, esté crédito le va a permitir invertir en la compra de equipo nuevo, mejorando el servicio que brinda en la zona,, ella tiene 50 años vive con su esposo y un hijo quienes le ayudan a atender el negocio en 3 jornadas diarias, obteniendo un mejor ingreso , para también reparar algunos  equipos.

	
	Ellas son mujeres empoderadas, luchadoras y muy trabajadoras, el trabajo en grupo las ha hecho fuertes y la organización en sí,  una buena estrategia para mantenerse en pie en estos 5 años. Su solidaridad y empeño para con los y las demás personas las destaca en su comunidad como mujeres que saben prestar un buen servicio  al Barrio Fray Casiano,  lugar al cual pertenecen en la provincia de Puntarenas. 


	Han participado como líderes en el Barrio Fray Casiano de Puntarenas un lugar con altos índices de pobreza y problemas sociales como drogas y delincuencia. Estas mujeres tratan de apoyar a otras más jóvenes como Giannina y Karol a buscar en el trabajo y esfuerzo, ganar el dinero para mantener sus hogares y a sus familias.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Profile for Mujer Mujeres en Acción
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
May 2013

The communal bank Mujer Mujeres en Acción is made up of 6 members who have worked in previous years with the Fundación Mujer as well as other groups in the Puntarenas area, demonstrating organization, solidarity, teamwork, while maintaining savings and a consolidated group. The loan applicants have been working in the area for 5 years. The Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción have a Board of Directors and they requested their 3rd loan for this group.

They have different activities and strengths permitting them to have an important base on which to guarantee this loan. The members are clear about how each one can generate income, they work as a team, jointly liable and saving together. Their work and efforts are validated through the support of institutions such as the Mixto de Ayuda Social and Fundación Mujer which has allowed them to have well-established activities, such as a grocery store, a bazaar, and Internet cafe, with equipment, a facility, and furniture for their businesses.

Flora has an Internet cafe. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of new equipment, improving the service she offers the area. She is 50 years old, lives with her husband and a son who help her run the business on 3 workdays, obtaining better income and also to repair some equipment.

They are empowered women, fighters and hardworking. The teamwork has been strong along with the organization itself, a good strategy for staying on their feet these 5 years. They stand out for their solidarity and commitment to other people in their community as women that know how to provide a good service for Barrio Fray Casiano, a place which belongs to the province of Puntarenas. They have participated as leaders in the Barrio Fray Casiano de Puntarenas, a place with high levels of poverty and social problems such as drugs and crime. These women try to help other young people such as Giannina and Karol looking for work and struggling to earn money to maintain their homes and families.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her Internet Cafe.

loans.name: La Lumiere 1 Group

texts.en:
Victorine, age 55, is divorced with 3 children, ages 21 to 29 years old. She is representing the La Lumiere 1 group. Victorine produces some food products and sells a variety of other food products. She makes fruit juice herself and sells it in the local market. She will use the loan to buy smoked fish and yogurt to sell also. She has had this business for 10 years. Her business strategy is to call her customers and let them know when she has fresh food to sell. 

She has received 5 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, and she has a good repayment record. Victorine wants to be a great businesswoman as she continues to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for juice makings, fish and yogurt.

loans.name: La Lumiere 2 Group

texts.en:
Jean, age 48, is married with 3 children, ages 9 months to 18 years old. He has 2 children currently attending school. He is representing the La Lumiere 2 group. Transportation is Jean's main business, but he also has a secondary business selling smoked fish in the market. He has a taxi and will use the loan to buy gasoline. 

He will also use the loan to buy smoked fish from a supplier. His business strategy is to drive to areas like the train station and airport to find clients for his taxi service. Jean has received 5 previous loans from HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. In the future he hopes to receive a large enough loan in order to buy another taxi.

loans.use: to pay for gasoline and smoked fish.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino, tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 6 hijos pero vive solo con uno de ellos y su hermana, vive en una aldea del municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. El se gana la vida con la pesca desde hace 10 años, saca variedad de pescado y lo vende en la comunidad. Ha sido cliente de ODEF por 8 ciclos con el actual, el cual es por 10,000 Lempiras, este préstamo lo utilizara para comprar equipo de pesca como cordeles, ganchos, plomos y dos termos usados. Su propósito es estar preparado para la pesca, incrementar el negocio y obtener buenas ganancias para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 45 years old, single, and has seven children. He lives with his sister and one of his children in a neighborhood in the town of Esparta, Atlántida.

Marcelino has been earning his living as a fisherman for 10 years. He catches a variety of fish and sells them in the community. Marcelino has been a client of ODEF for eight loan cycles. His current loan is in the amount of 10,000 HNL and will be used to buy fishing equipment such as ropes, hooks, sinkers, and two used coolers. His goal is to become prepared to fish so that he can increase his business and generate good income for his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy ropes, hooks, sinkers, and two used coolers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old. She is a dry cereals dealer and a grinding machine owner in Maweni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of four schoolchildren whose husband earns additional income, and she is doing great.

This marks her second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase dry cereals, maize and wheat grains for grinding in her grinding machine. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her cereal stock. She hopes to sell flour in bulk as other millers do.

loans.use: to purchase dry cereals, maize and wheat grains.

loans.name: Kintouadi 2 Group

texts.en:
Placide, age 39, is single with 5 children, ages 12 to 17 years old. Three of the children are currently attending school. He is representing the Kintouadi 2 group. 

He has a frozen foods shop in the market. He sells a variety of frozen foods, but will use this loan to buy more frozen chicken and fish. He has had this business for 12 years. His business strategy is to offer friendly, prompt, and consistent customer service to his clients. His business has gained a good reputation in his community.
 
Placide has received 1 previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record with HOPE. His goal is to eventually open a butcher shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for frozen chicken and fish.

loans.name: Kintouadi 3 Group

texts.en:
Alexis, aged 49, is single. He has 4 children from 3 to 20 years old, 3 of whom attend school. He is representing the Kintouadi 3 group. He has a pharmacy that he has been operating for 10 years. He will use the loan to buy more medicine to sell. His business strategy is to be friendly and helpful to his customers. Many people and ask him what types of medicine are needed for a certain ailment. If he doesn't know the correct medicine he searches for the answer. 

Alexis has received 1 previous loan from Kiva partner HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He plans to construct a large building for his pharmacy in the future. He hopes his children will succeed in school.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to sell.

loans.name: L'excellence 1 Group

texts.en:
Chanie, age 36, is married with 3 children, ages 9 to 15. All 3 of her kids are attending school. She is representing the group L'excellence 1. Chanie has a grocery and butcher shop which she has been operating for three and a half years. She will use the loan to replenish her stock of groceries and meat to sell. Her business strategy is to decrease her prices below those of her competitors around her at the end of the day. Her customers know that if they come to her shop then, they will get the best deals. 

Chanie has received 3 previous loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She wants to continue to expand her business and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food and meat.

loans.name: L'excellence 3 Group

texts.en:
Steel, age 32, is single with a 4 year old daughter. She is representing the group L'excellence 3. She sells sandals, drinks, and charcoal in a local market. She has been a vendor in the market for 4 years. She will use the loan to buy more sandals and charcoal to sell. Her business strategy is to market her merchandise. She uses a megaphone to announce her products and prices. 

Steel has received 3 previous loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She wants to continue her business and open a large store in the future. She hopes her daughter will become a doctor one day. She plans to help her meet this goal as much as she can.

loans.use: to buy sandals and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Doña dora de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia ella tiene una tortillería en su lugar de residencia  desde hace 2 años tiene mucha clientela pues les  brinda un buen servicio,  las vende a buen precio y es muy limpia a la hora de elaborar dichos alimentos, con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas logra solventar los gastos de su casa, Doña Dora solicita un crédito que le permita comprar maíz pues con eso elabora las tortillas  y así ella obtendrá mejores ganancias de sus ventas y podrá solventar los gastos de su casa sin ningún limitante.
texts.en: Dora is 46 years old and lives in a home of her own with her family.  She has a tortilla factory in her home, has had it for two years, and has many customers because she provides good service, sells at good prices, and is very clean when she makes these foods.  She is able to pay the household expenses with her earnings.  Dora is asking for a loan to buy corn because she uses it to make tortillas and in this way she can increase her sales and will be able to pay her household expenses without limits.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Nelly Kati

texts.es: Nelly una mujer trabajadora y carismática casada y madre de 02 hijos la cual sigue apoyando. A sus 40 años Nelly ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda y mantener su negocio se siente feliz por sus logros. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de  comida la cual lo realiza a reparto. Esta actividad surge con los deseos de contar con un negocio propio, y de esta manera generar ingresos para su hogar.   En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos y utensilios para su negocio. Su mayor deseo es de tener un restaurante, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. Nelly se siente feliz al saber que personas de otros países colaboran en su progreso y se compromete a seguir siendo una socia responsable.
texts.en: Nelly is a hardworking and charismatic woman.  She is married and has two children whom she continues to support.  At age 40, Nelly has managed to achieve some dreams such as improving her home and keeping her business.  She feels happy about her achievements.  She sells food, which she delivers.  This began with a desire to have a business of her own and she is able to generate income for her home.  She is asking for a loan to buy supplies and utensils for her business.  Her greatest desire is to have a restaurant so she can have greater earnings.  Nelly is grateful to those who help other countries with their progress and she promises to continue being socially responsible.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.
