В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кларацеткин обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого рогатого скота.  Доходы от кредита Кларацеткин планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Klaratsetkin is 59 years old, a widow, and has two sons. As a source of income for her family, Klaratsetkin works with livestock breeding, after having started this business with 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Klaratsetkin's persistent work, her farm currently has three cows, three sheep and three goats. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Klaratsetkin turned to the micro finance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep and goats. Klaratsetkin plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil is 38 years old. He lives in Marneuli district with his 28-year-old wife Naiba. Gabil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The only source of the income for the family is from trading fruits and vegetables. Gabil purchases products from the villagers and brings it to the main market in Marneuli district, where all the products are sold with a price mark up. 

Gabil requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Gabil has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Gabil will purchase a mini-bus. He wants to expand his trading business. With the mini-bus, Gabil will be able to purchase more products to sell. This will significantly increase his profit. Part of the profit he will be reinvested in the same field to purchase more fruits and vegetables and another part will be used for his family's well being.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Susan operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 20 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Susan dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 35 años de edad, es soltera y  tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 4 años de edad respectivamente quienes son su principal motivo de inspiración y esfuerzo diario ya que trabaja para brindarles todo lo que necesitan. Vive junto a ellos en la casa de su madre a lado su padre y su hermana.La actividad que realiza Elizabeth es el alquiler de juegos de videos, para lo cual instaló en su casa un pequeño local contando con todos los permisos y licencias de ley que le permitan desarrollar su actividad.. Se inició hace 1 año con la compra de un televisor y solo 5 juegos que eran los más requeridos en ese entonces, con el tiempo se han ido incrementando sus implementos y ahora tiene 2 televisores cada uno de ellos instalado al dispositivo que permite iniciar el juego.Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso fluido de la clientela a quienes atiende con mucha amabilidad, por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es el desorden que en algunas ocasiones se genera cuando su local esta lleno, espera continuar trabajando y seguir generando sus ingresos económicos ya que tiene planeado establecer otro tipo de negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio , por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará un televisor que usará para seguir trabajando, con el monto restante adquirirá nuevos videojuegos que están siendo solicitados en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old, single, and has two children who are 4 and 14 years old.  They are her main motivation for inspiration and daily strength since she works to give them everything they need.  She lives with them in her mother's house together with her father and sister.  

Elizabeth works renting video games.  She installed a small store in her home along with all the permits and legal licenses that allow her to do that work.  She started a year ago by purchasing a television and only five games, which were the most popular at that time.  With time, she has grown the business and now has two televisions that each have a device installed that allows the game to be played.  The thing she likes about her work is the fluid customer flow, who she attends to with a lot of kindness.  On the other hand, she does not like the disorder that happens sometimes when the store is full.  She hopes to continue working and generating income since she plans to start another type of business.  

Currently she is requesting 3000 soles.  She is very happy to have financial support since she will feel secure moving forward with her business.  She promises again to make her repayments on time.  

She will use the loan to purchase a television that she will use to continue working.  She will also purchase new video games that are being requested in this season.

loans.use: to purchase a television for video games.

loans.name: Juana Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Juana Lucia,
Ella es originaria del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 57 años de edad tiene bajo su responsabilidad sus a dos hijos, ella tiene una tienda de venta de ropa, y venta de refacciones.
Desde hace algunos años ella viene vendiendo ropa y también a la venta de refacciones y gracias a dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante.
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que el apoyo de ellos a ayudado mucho para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es surtir mas su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias para poder mandar a sus hijos a un mejor colegio para un futuro mejor. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta, y compra de mercaderias para la elaboracion de refacciones
texts.en:
Juana Lucia,

She is originally from the municipality of Tecpan in Guatemala.  She is 57-years-old and she is responsible for her two sons. She has a store where she sells clothing and refreshments.

For a few years now she has been selling clothes and refreshments.  Thanks to God, little by little, she has been able to get ahead.  Thanks to the help of her sons, she continues with the business because their help has been very beneficial.

Her dream is to grow her business and therefore improve her income to be able to send her sons to a better school for a better future. She is requesting a loan to purchase new clothes to sell and purchase merchandise for the sale of refreshments.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing for sale and purchase merchandise for the sale of refreshments

loans.name: Usenbai

texts.ru:
Усенбаю 47 лет, имеет 5 детей. Усенбай в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, полеводством , стартовав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Усенбая, на данный момент в его хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 20 овец, арендованная земля в 2 га засажена перцем и многолетними травами. Также, Усенбай оказывает услуги чабана.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Усенбай обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 1 лошади, мелкого рогатого скота и селитры.  Доходы от кредита Усенбай планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, и намерен оплачивать обучение старшего сына, который закончил школу.
texts.en:
Usenbai is 47 years old and has five children. As a source of income for his family, Usenbai works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Usenbai's persistent work, his farm currently has two cows, 20 sheep and 2 hectares of rented land planted with peppers and perennial grasses. Further, Usenbai provides shepherd services. 

With an aim to further develop his business, Usenbai turned to the micro finance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of one horse, sheep, goats and nitrates. Usenbai plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding his business, and intents to pay for the education of his eldest son, who has finished school.

loans.use: to purchase one horse, sheep, goats and nitrate

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children, a 6-year-old and a 13-year-old. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in an open, busy market, and her primary customers are local residents.

Tabitha describes her biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more shoes to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler, selling shoes to retailers and customers in the environs within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will cater for her family's financial needs with the profit she will get from the business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Ms Naheed is a 37-year-old woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She started a business sewing gloves five months ago. While her husband is employed in a small factory, his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone.  Naheed is contentedly doing her business for the sake of her family. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. To increase her sales she needs to purchase a new sewing machine and some more spools of thread so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 25,000. She hopes to get a boost in her net income through her larger sales and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and more spools of threads.

loans.name: Rafique

texts.en: Ms Rafique is a 44-year-old vigorous, married woman and a mother of three children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. Two of her daughters also assist her in making beautiful patterns. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed in a small garment shop, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Rafique’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 25000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to complete the maximum orders on time. She would like to teach embroidery skills to the girls of her community, so they can help her expand her business and earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es: El Sr. Lelis sigue con la misma actividad de fabricación y   venta de muebles, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de materiales como laminas, en esta ocasión  con el dinero del crédito comprara madera para la fabricación de sus muebles.
texts.en: Lelis continues to make and sell furniture. The previous loan went well, and he used it to buy materials like sheets. This time, with the money from the loan, he will buy wood to make his furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Mamiah

texts.en:
Mamiah is living together with her fiancee and four children in the Paynesville area, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 30 years old. Her children are between five and fourteen years old and attend school. 

For the seven years she has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She started this business with a small amount received from her fiancee. She enjoys the profit she makes from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to enlarge her business,

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with one school-going kid. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

Asha is requesting a KES 40,000 loan, which she wants in order to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sahira

texts.en: Ms Sahira is a 37-year-old married woman. She is doing a business raising cattle. She has been in this line of work for five years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. Her husband is laborer and his income is not sufficient to fulfill the family needs alone. So she started cattle work and she is very supportive of her family in a productive manner. Sahira has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  In order to purchase more sheep and feed, she applied for a loan of Rs 30,000. She has been in association with Kashf for five years. She dreams of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and feed.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 24-year-old single man who has been working in transportation since a year ago. He is well known in his region for his good reputation and manners. He works on providing transportation services to his region’s citizens, to and from schools and businesses among nearby villages.

Hamza is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance on his van's body.

This loan will improve his business, will attract more customers to a newly shaped van, and will please his present customers.

He is excited about this loan; he will start taking touristic visits around Lebanon, but as he states, the van has to look good to take certain tours abroad. He hopes to keep on improving his business as much as he can in a well managed way.

loans.use: to do necessary body work on his van.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is a 52-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and three children in Punjab, Pakistan. For about two years, she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, Sajida has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Sajida dreams of her children's bright future and is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Dalcy Pamela

texts.es: La Sra. Dalcy tiene 29 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Satelite,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Dalcy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Dalcy is 29 years old and makes a living in the sale of essential goods in her neighbourhood store in the Satelite neighbourhood.

This is her first loan cycle with this institution. She will use this loan to buy merchandise for her store, such as groceries, sweets and soft drinks. Dalcy is requesting this loan because of the high demand she faces, and she needs more merchandise so she can increase her sales.

The biggest challenge for Dalcy's business is competition, since there are other shops in her neighbourhood. She will use her increased profits to buy more merchandise so she can stock up her store and keep growing every day.

Her wish for her business is to keep selling and have a fully stocked store. This way she can expand her business, increase her income and improve her quality of life, as well as her family's.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.en:
Rajabgul is 41 years old. She is married and has one child. She always wanted to provide him with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Rajabgul decided to start a new business with animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances.

She studied at the course, “To get ahead” organization for women, and got enough skills about business.  Her husband will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman, as she is hardworking and smart. 

Rajabgul is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She will get through, using the loan. Her business will get to be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Ms. Kausar is a 23-year-old hardworking lady. For the past two years, Kausar has been running a tailoring business. She knows very well the techniques of stitching and designing, and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. By this time she has attained regular list of customers. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and also applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more spools of threads and cloth with packs of needles and scissors. In this way she would be able to complete the orders on time. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support and wishes to provide better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads and cloth with packs of needles and scissors.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the loving mother of four children, two daughters and two sons. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

For the past four years, she has been engaged in the business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She performs the task of collecting milk and then sells it to the people of her community. She makes enough to lead a decent life. 

In order to increase her sales, she needs to purchase one more buffalo. For this reason, she applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to Kashf Foundation. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom.
